text: Police allege Eric Allen Kirkpatrick , 61 , opened fire at the TallGrass Distribution Ltd Christmas party , killing Benjamin David Banky , 40 .
marked_sentence: Police allege Eric Allen Kirkpatrick , 61 , opened fire at the TallGrass Distribution Ltd Christmas party , <mark id="mark_id"> killing </mark> Benjamin David Banky , 40 .
marked_doc: A man has been charged with first-degree murder after a shooting at an office Christmas party in Vancouver Friday . <p/>Police allege Eric Allen Kirkpatrick , 61 , opened fire at the TallGrass Distribution Ltd Christmas party , <mark id="mark_id"> killing </mark> Benjamin David Banky , 40 . <p/>Banky was the CEO of TallGrass Distribution Ltd. , a natural health products company . <p/>At least a dozen employees had been celebrating when the gunman , who had been recently laid off , entered the party and began firing a gun , according to Vancouver Police spokesperson Const. Tim Fanning . <p/>The other partygoers managed to escape unharmed . <p/>`` The shock was tremendous but all the other people in the business - and there another dozen other people who were there for a Christmas party - managed to get out safely , '' Fanning said . <p/>Police locked down the neighbourhood before the suspect turned himself in around 6 p.m . <p/>Police said Kirkpatrick was let go on Dec. 11 . <p/>A resident who lives in a nearby apartment building told The Canadian Press that he did not hear gunshots , but saw a woman run from the party and into a nearby auto repair shop , where it appears she called for help . <p/>`` All of a sudden in my front yard there were five totally decked out , geared up riot squad officers with guns out of the holster , aiming at the second floor of the building right beside us , '' Luke Pigeon said . <p/>`` I tried to open up my door and they said close your door , lock your door . '' <p/>Mark Pinder told The Canadian Press that police ordered a group of film studio employees into the basement of their building , which was across the street from the party . <p/>The group was just about to celebrate the completion of a project when police came knocking , he said . <p/>`` People grabbed a couple of bowls of chips and dip and we just sort of moved the party downstairs , '' Pinder said . <p/>`` Some people seemed quite concerned but there was n't anyone freaking out or crying . <p/>Everyone was calling their family and making sure that people knew they were OK . '' <p/>Pigeon said police spent about two hours negotiating with the suspect before bringing him into custody . <p/>`` They cuffed him on the ground and they took him into a cruiser , '' he said . <p/>`` He was giving them a bit of grief , he was saying that his cuffs hurt , but he was following orders . '' <p/>Employees who had been at the party at the time of the shooting are receiving counselling from the Vancouver police victim 's services team . <p/>`` I can not emphasize enough how traumatic this would have been for the people in there to see one of their co-workers gunned down , so we 're going to do all we can to help these people though a very , very difficult time , '' Fanning said .

text: An Indian warship , INS Mysore deployed in the Gulf of Aden attacked two boats of pirates after receiving signals from a ship that the pirates were trying to hijack .
marked_sentence: An Indian warship , INS Mysore deployed in the Gulf of Aden attacked two boats of pirates after receiving signals from a ship that the pirates were trying to <mark id="mark_id"> hijack </mark> .
marked_doc: Taking the lead in the fight against piracy , the Indian Navy on Saturday arrested 23 Somali pirates . <p/>An Indian warship , INS Mysore deployed in the Gulf of Aden attacked two boats of pirates after receiving signals from a ship that the pirates were trying to <mark id="mark_id"> hijack </mark> . <p/>The Indian warship was patrolling in the Somali waters when it rushed to rescue MV Gibe , a merchant vessel flying the Ethiopian flag . <p/>The pirates on two speed boats had surrounded the merchant vessel , when INS Mysore warship intervened and warded off the attack , Navy spokesperson said here . <p/>The pirates had fired at the merchant vessel with their small arms , when it sent out a rescue call and the Indian warship , which was sailing nearby moved its Marine Commandos on an helicopter to help the distressed cargo vessel , he said . <p/>The attack took place about 150 nautical miles off Aden and INS Mysore was about 13 nautical miles away from the merchant vessel when it picked up the SOS call . <p/>The Navy flew its Marine Commandos on helicopters to the scene of the pirate attack and rescued the ship. MV Gibe was later escorted to safety , he added . <p/>The Indian commandos also recovered 12 AK 47 guns , three rifles , two grenades along with other ammunition . <p/>Out of 23 arrested pirates , 12 are reportedly from Somalia and 11 from Yemen . <p/>The Indian warship , the INS Mysore , was dispatched to the Gulf of Aden after a spike in piracy and hijackings off the coast of Somalia , which is caught up in an Islamic insurgency and has had no functioning government since 1991 .

text: On Saturday , 32 - year - old Englishman Robert Buckley , originally from Essex , but living in Christchurch , fell about 2 , 000ft while climbing to a small hut on Mount Sefton with three companions .
marked_sentence: On Saturday , 32 - year - old Englishman Robert Buckley , originally from Essex , but living in Christchurch , fell about 2 , 000ft while <mark id="mark_id"> climbing </mark> to a small hut on Mount Sefton with three companions .
marked_doc: http : / / www . telegraph . co . uk / news / worldnews / australiaandthepacific / newzealand / 10311656 / English - and - Australian - climbers - fall - to - their - deaths - in - New - Zealand - mountains . html <p/>English and Australian climbers fall to their deaths in New Zealand mountains <p/>One Australian and one English climber have fallen to their deaths in New Zealand . <p/>8 : 44AM BST 16 Sep 2013 <p/>Police Inspector Dave Gaskin said the two incidents on consecutive days in the Aoraki - Mt . Cook National Park were not related and were not due to bad weather . <p/>He said they come as a reminder that climbers need to use extreme caution . <p/>On Friday , 36 - year - old Duncan Rait died after slipping and falling about 200ft from a ridge near the Tasman Glacier . <p/>The New Zealand - born Australian was planning to do some ski touring . <p/>He ’ d been dropped off by helicopter with a group and was walking to a hut when he fell , sliding down a steep slope and over a cliff . <p/>Gaskin said that other climbers attempted to rescue Raite by taking him down the glacier , but that he died on the way down . <p/>On Saturday , 32 - year - old Englishman Robert Buckley , originally from Essex , but living in Christchurch , fell about 2 , 000ft while <mark id="mark_id"> climbing </mark> to a small hut on Mount Sefton with three companions . <p/>Gaskin said Buckley was wearing crampons but was inexperienced . <p/>Police said that Mr Buckley's group appeared to be "insufficiently" equipped and inexperienced for the climb they chose . <p/>"They had hired some climbing equipment early that day and had managed to get within 80 meters of the bivvy , " police said . <p/>"At this stage . . . one of the party has slipped on the ice and has fallen some 700 metres to his death . "

text: Woman Killed In Queens Hit - And - Run Accident , Driver Charged
marked_sentence: Woman Killed In Queens Hit - And - Run <mark id="mark_id"> Accident </mark> , Driver Charged
marked_doc: http : / / cached . newslookup . com / cached . php ? ref _ id=225&siteid=2182&id=3110701&t=1379163972 <p/>Woman Killed In Queens Hit - And - Run <mark id="mark_id"> Accident </mark> , Driver Charged <p/>Updated 9 : 06 AM <p/>A woman has died after being hit by a car that fled the scene in Queens , and now , the driver is facing manslaughter charges . <p/>Witnesses say 59 - year - old Raj Chohan was leaving her car on 117th Street in South Richmond Hill Friday when she was hit by a silver Toyota Camry and sent flying into the air . <p/>She died at the hospital . <p/>Police caught up with the driver , who is from Schnectady , a few blocks away . <p/>He has been charged with vehicular manslaughter , negligent homicide and fleeing the scene of an accident .

text: 66-year-old Luann Johnson , of Burnsville , was hit while walking in the crosswalk around 7 p.m. Wednesday night .
marked_sentence: 66-year-old Luann Johnson , of Burnsville , was <mark id="mark_id"> hit </mark> while walking in the crosswalk around 7 p.m. Wednesday night .
marked_doc: Pedestrian Fatally Hit Outside Bloomington Sam 's Club <p/>Police use Taser to arrest hit-and-run suspect <p/>Police have arrested a man in the hit -and-run death of a woman in the parking lot crosswalk at Sam 's Club in Bloomington . <p/>66-year-old Luann Johnson , of Burnsville , was <mark id="mark_id"> hit </mark> while walking in the crosswalk around 7 p.m. Wednesday night . <p/>The driver fled the scene after the woman was hit . <p/>Her husband watched it happen . <p/>Anthony Phillip LaSalle , 36 , of Bloomington , was pulled over a few blocks away , where police say he was uncooperative , refusing to exit his car . <p/>After the suspected motorist hit the woman , he allegedly hit another car in the parking lot and another car on American Boulevard . <p/>There , LaSalle , also known by law enforcement as `` Crazy T , '' was eventually Tasered and taken into custody . <p/>He has a prior DWI conviction in Minnetonka from 1992 . <p/>Police say alcohol was a factor in the accident . <p/>LaSalle is expected to face charges on Friday of criminal vehicular homicide , DWI , and driving with a limited license .

text: Jury finds suspect in Troy office shooting guilty
marked_sentence: Jury finds suspect in Troy office <mark id="mark_id"> shooting </mark> guilty
marked_doc: http : / / blog . mlive . com / grpress / 2008 / 04 / jury _ finds _ suspect _ in _ troy _ off . html <p/>Jury finds suspect in Troy office <mark id="mark_id"> shooting </mark> guilty <p/>on April 30 , 2008 at 4 : 31 AM , updated April 30 , 2008 at 8 : 33 AM <p/>A jury on Tuesday convicted a man charged in an April 2007 shooting at a Troy accounting firm that left a receptionist dead and two managing partners wounded . <p/>Anthony LaCalamita III was found guilty of first - degree murder and assault with intent to murder in the shotgun slaying of 63 - year - old Madeline Kafoury and assault with intent to kill in the shootings of Paul Riva and Alan Steinberg at the accounting firm . <p/>Defense attorney Jerome Fenton argued LaCalamita's extensive history of mental illness was to blame . <p/>Assistant Oakland County Prosecutor Rob Novy said the 39 - year - old Troy man shot his former co - workers because he was furious over his firing four days earlier .

text: A Michigan man shot to death one person and injured two others Monday at the suburban Detroit accounting firm from which he was fired last week , police said .
marked_sentence: A Michigan man shot to death one person and <mark id="mark_id"> injured </mark> two others Monday at the suburban Detroit accounting firm from which he was fired last week , police said .
marked_doc: http : / / edition . cnn . com / 2007 / US / 04 / 09 / michigan . shooting / <p/>Sheriff : Michigan office shooting kills 1 , injures 2 <p/>POSTED : 1052 GMT ( 1852 HKT ) , April 10 , 2007 <p/>A Michigan man shot to death one person and <mark id="mark_id"> injured </mark> two others Monday at the suburban Detroit accounting firm from which he was fired last week , police said . <p/>The suspect , 38 - year - old Anthony LaCalamita , was "deliberately seeking out these individuals , " according to Troy police Lt . Gerry Scherlinck . <p/>A female receptionist died and two men , believed to be "management level employees , " underwent surgery for gunshot wounds at Royal Oak Beaumont Hospital , Scherlinck said . <p/>A 50 - year - old man from Dexter , Michigan , tipped off authorities to LaCalamita's location after hearing a description of the suspect's vehicle - - a 2007 silver Ford Fusion - - on the radio . <p/>The man , who did not want to be identified , called 911 when he realized the vehicle directly next to him matched the description on the radio , according to Genesee County Sheriff Robert Pickell . <p/>Police attempted to stop the vehicle as it entered Vienna township , but LaCalamita would not pull over , Pickell said . <p/>LaCalamita drove across several counties , at speeds up to 120 miles per hour , surrendering only after authorities boxed in his car on Interstate 75 in Saginaw , Michigan . <p/>He surrendered "peacefully and without incident , " Pickell said . <p/>Upon arrest , police seized a shotgun and several shells , he said . <p/>LaCalamita is being held in the Genesee County jail and is expected to be handed over to the Detroit police . <p/>A Web site for the public accounting firm Gordon Advisors in the building lists LaCalamita as an employee . <p/>"We heard gunshots . . . . <p/>We're on the third floor , barricaded in , " Bill Adgate , who works for LPL Financial in the office building , told CNN affiliate WDIV - TV as the search went on for the gunman . <p/>"We put a conference table in front of the front door with a bunch of chairs , " Adgate told WDIV , a Detroit station . <p/>"We have four entrances - - three entrances to our offices . <p/>We put file cabinets and things of that nature in front of it . " <p/>Monday's shooting follows two last week in public places in Atlanta , Georgia , and Seattle , Washington . <p/>In Atlanta's CNN Center on Tuesday , police say a man shot to death his former girlfriend just downstairs from the center's Omni Hotel and outside the CNN . com newsroom . <p/>On Monday on the Seattle campus of the University of Washington , a gunman killed his former girlfriend and then himself . <p/>In early March , a gunman shot and wounded three people at a printing facility near Los Angeles , California , before killing himself . <p/>Police said he was a disgruntled employee of the facility in Signal Hill , California . <p/>In February , a gunman killed five people and injured several others at a shopping mall in Salt Lake City , Utah , before an off - duty policeman killed the shooter .

text: Employees at a Vancouver wholesaler were coping Saturday with the death of their boss , who was gunned down at their office Christmas party .
marked_sentence: Employees at a Vancouver wholesaler were <mark id="mark_id"> coping </mark> Saturday with the death of their boss , who was gunned down at their office Christmas party .
marked_doc: Employees at a Vancouver wholesaler were <mark id="mark_id"> coping </mark> Saturday with the death of their boss , who was gunned down at their office Christmas party . <p/>A man facing murder charges in a Christmas party shooting was on suicide watch Monday as friends and family of paid glowing tribute to his alleged victim . <p/>Those who knew Benjamin David Banky , 40 , were still in shock three days after he was gunned down during what was supposed to be a Christmas celebration at his office . <p/>His accused killer , Eric Kirkpatrick , made a brief appearance in Vancouver provincial court Monday on a charge of first-degree murder . <p/>Banky was CEO of TallGrass Distribution Ltd. , a wholesaler of natural health products , which remained closed Monday . <p/>`` He was incredibly bright , a very caring person and incredibly family-oriented , '' said Nancy O'Higgins , a longtime family friend . <p/>O'Higgins and her husband Eric , both retired journalists , knew Ben as a baby because they worked in the media in Ontario with Ben 's father Jake before both families moved west , six months apart . <p/>The O'Higgins ' attended Ben 's wedding a couple of years ago on Hornby Island , one of the Gulf Islands where his parents now live . <p/>`` They were n't married very long , just a couple of years . '' <p/>She said Ben and his wife grew up as neighbours on Hornby Island . <p/>`` That was how Ben and Linda knew each other . '' <p/>Ben attended school in his early years in White Rock but got most of his education in Victoria where his father worked for Broadcast News , which is now The Canadian Press . <p/>She said he travelled to China for awhile , where he studied Mandarin and was quite fluent . <p/>`` I was so incredibly impressed that he spoke Mandarin that that really stuck in my head , '' said O'Higgins . <p/>John Banky , Ben 's older brother , spoke briefly from the parents ' home Monday , alluding to his brother 's musical abilities . <p/>`` He spoke a few languages and could play any instrument made by man , '' said his brother . <p/>While the family tried to deal with the loss , Kirkpatrick made a brief appearance in court . <p/>His lawyer , Richard Fowler , told the court his client is on suicide watch at the North Fraser Pretrial Centre in Port Coquitlam . <p/>Fowler described conditions at the centre as unacceptable , saying his client is double-bunked with a man who is withdrawing from a drug addiction and the cell is cold . <p/>Much of B.C. is in the grips of a cold spell , with unusually cold temperatures in the Vancouver area that are well below freezing . <p/>Kirkpatrick , who has long grey hair flowing down to his shoulders and a long grey beard , was dressed in red , prison-issue coveralls . <p/>He stood quietly in the prisoner 's box listening to the proceedings . <p/>The sixty-one-year-old was arrested Friday , not long after Banky was shot to death . <p/>Outside court , Fowler said Kirkpatrick is `` not doing very well . '' <p/>`` He is placed in a double bunk with somebody who is withdrawing from drugs . <p/>He can not sleep . <p/>It 's freezing cold . <p/>The problem is that these institutions are too full . '' <p/>`` He 's presumed innocent and he should be treated better . '' <p/>Lon Wood , another retired Victoria journalist who knew Ben 's father from their days working in Victoria , said he met Ben and the other children through their parents . <p/>`` They are a very close family . '' <p/>John Paul Fraser of National Public Relations , which is working for TallGrass , said the family is not speaking publicly yet . <p/>At a weekend news conference , city police spokesman Const . <p/>Tim Fanning said Kirkpatrick had been let go from TallGrass on Thursday . <p/>Fanning did n't know how long the suspect had worked at the business . <p/>The other people at the office party were able to escape without injury , Fanning said . <p/>`` The shock was tremendous but all the other people in the business - and a dozen other people who were there for a Christmas party - managed to get out safely , '' Fanning said . <p/>The shocked party-goers were put on buses and taken to police headquarters where witness statements were taken , he said . <p/>He said counsellors have been made available to them .

text: The American Medical Association is delighted that Dr . Regina Benjamin , MD , has been nominated to serve as our nation's next U . S . Surgeon General .
marked_sentence: The American Medical Association is <mark id="mark_id"> delighted </mark> that Dr . Regina Benjamin , MD , has been nominated to serve as our nation's next U . S . Surgeon General .
marked_doc: http : / / www . ama - assn . org / ama / pub / news / news / regina - benjamin - surgeon - general . page <p/>AMA Celebrates Nomination of Regina Benjamin , MD , Surgeon General <p/>For immediate release : <p/>July 13 , 2009 <p/>The American Medical Association is <mark id="mark_id"> delighted </mark> that Dr . Regina Benjamin , MD , has been nominated to serve as our nation's next U . S . Surgeon General . <p/>Her many impressive accomplishments , including receiving a 2008 MacArthur Fellowship , commonly known as the "genius grant" , leave no doubt as to her qualifications . <p/>"Dr . Benjamin's most important qualification for surgeon general is her deep commitment to her patients . <p/>We are particularly gratified to see her recognized for her work caring for patients in rural Alabama , and for her commitment to rebuilding her rural health clinic in the wake of Hurricane Katrina . <p/>She is a true professional who puts her patients first . <p/>The AMA is immensely proud of Dr . Benjamin's accomplishments , and we are extremely fortunate that she has just served a term as chair of the AMA's Council on Ethical and Judicial Affairs . <p/>She served as a member of the AMA's Board of Trustees with the dual distinctions of being the AMA's first young physician trustee , as well as the first African - American woman board member . <p/>We look forward to seeing Dr . Benjamin serve as an advocate for all the nation's patients , as our country works toward health reform that provides high quality , affordable health coverage for all . "

text: Indian naval forces came to the rescue of a merchant vessel under attack by pirates in the Gulf of Aden on Saturday , capturing 23 of the raiders , India said .
marked_sentence: Indian naval forces came to the rescue of a merchant vessel under attack by pirates in the Gulf of Aden on Saturday , <mark id="mark_id"> capturing </mark> 23 of the raiders , India said .
marked_doc: Indian naval forces came to the rescue of a merchant vessel under attack by pirates in the Gulf of Aden on Saturday , <mark id="mark_id"> capturing </mark> 23 of the raiders , India said . <p/>India 's INS Mysore and its armed helicopter were on anti-piracy patrol when they received a distress call from the Ethiopian-flagged MV Gibe saying two boats were closing in and firing , a Defence Ministry statement said . <p/>`` On sighting the helicopter and Mysore , the boats disengaged from MV Gibe and attempted escape . <p/>Mysore closed the vessels and ordered them to stop . '' <p/>Indian commandos boarded the larger pirate boat , seizing 12 Somali and 11 Yemeni nationals as well as arms and equipment , the statement said . <p/>A surge in piracy this year in the busy Gulf of Aden and Indian Ocean off Somalia has driven up insurance costs , earned the gangs tens of millions of dollars in ransoms , and prompted foreign navies to rush to the area to protect shipping . <p/>Several international naval operations are under way off Somalia , including a NATO anti-piracy mission . <p/>The Indian Navy in November said it had sunk the Somali pirate `` mother ship '' , though an anti-piracy watchdog later said the vessel was actually a Thai ship carrying fishing equipment that was being hijacked . <p/>Somalia has seen continuous conflict since 1991 and its weak Western-backed government is still fighting Islamist insurgents . <p/>The chaos has helped fuel the explosion in piracy . <p/>There have been nearly 100 attacks in Somali waters this year . <p/>Pirates holding about a dozen ships and nearly 300 crewmen in safe havens on the Somali coast . <p/>Among the captured vessels are a Saudi supertanker loaded with $ 100 million of crude oil , the Sirius Star , and a Ukrainian cargo ship carrying some 30 Soviet-era tanks , the MV Faina .

text: The Indian Navy patrolling the Gulf of Aden on Thursday thwarted a multi - boat attack by sea brigands on merchant vessels , apprehending 26 Somali pirates and confiscating arms and ammunition , in the fifth successful anti - piracy operation since September .
marked_sentence: The Indian Navy patrolling the Gulf of Aden on Thursday thwarted a multi - boat attack by sea brigands on merchant vessels , <mark id="mark_id"> apprehending </mark> 26 Somali pirates and confiscating arms and ammunition , in the fifth successful anti - piracy operation since September .
marked_doc: http : / / www . thehindu . com / news / national / navy - foils - somali - pirate - attack - off - gulf - of - aden / article2618961 . ece <p/>Updated : November 11 , 2011 20 : 09 IST <p/>Navy foils Somali pirate attack off Gulf of Aden <p/>The Indian Navy patrolling the Gulf of Aden on Thursday thwarted a multi - boat attack by sea brigands on merchant vessels , <mark id="mark_id"> apprehending </mark> 26 Somali pirates and confiscating arms and ammunition , in the fifth successful anti - piracy operation since September . <p/>At 9 . 25 a . m . on Thursday , navy personnel aboard warship INS Sukanya spotted a group of five suspicious boats speedily approaching the merchant vessels of her group . <p/>“ The warship immediately altered ( its direction ) towards the suspicious vessels and challenged them . <p/>On seeing the resolve evident in the warship ’ s action and probably mindful of the reputation for resolute action that the Indian Navy justly enjoys in such deployments , the pirate skiffs reversed course and tried to flee the area , ” Captain Manohar Nambiar , Chief Public Relations Officer , Defence , said . <p/>While two of them managed to escape , INS Sukanya successfully intercepted the remaining three boats and , in a well - practiced and professionally executed boarding - and - search action , nabbed 26 Somali pirates with six AK 47 rifles , 12 magazines and about 300 rounds of ammunition . <p/>This is the fifth successful anti - piracy operation conducted by INS Sukanya in the course of her ongoing patrol mission in the Gulf of Aden that commenced in September , the Navy said . <p/>INS Sukanya , currently deployed on anti - piracy patrols in the Gulf of Aden under the operational control of the Western Naval Command , was escorting a group of five merchant vessels through the Internationally Recognised Transit Corridor when the incident happened . <p/>The timely operation by INS Sukanya resulted , once again , in foiling the pirates ’ attempt to attack merchant vessels transiting the busy sea lane through which over nearly $100 billion worth India ’ s external trade passes each year , Captain Nambiar said . <p/>In their five operations so far , the personnel on board the warship have confiscated 14 AK - 47 Rifles , 31 magazines and 923 rounds of ammunition , he said . <p/>Indian Navy is part of the international effort to ensure the safety and freedom of seaborne trade in this high - risk stronghold of modern - day piracy .

text: A former employee walked into a staff Christmas party at an east Vancouver health products business Friday and shot and killed a man , according to police .
marked_sentence: A former employee walked into a staff Christmas <mark id="mark_id"> party </mark> at an east Vancouver health products business Friday and shot and killed a man , according to police .
marked_doc: A former employee walked into a staff Christmas <mark id="mark_id"> party </mark> at an east Vancouver health products business Friday and shot and killed a man , according to police . <p/>Police said they were called to Tallgrass Distributors Ltd. , in the central Mount Pleasant neighbourhood , where a man carrying a firearm had confronted the crowd . <p/>`` A man who apparently had just been let go from his job there came in , shot and killed another man , '' Vancouver police Const. Tim Fanning told a news conference . <p/>`` There was at least a dozen other people on the scene . <p/>They managed to get out . <p/>`` Our negotiators got on the phone with him right away , and fortunately were able to talk him down from his very , very excited and upset state . '' <p/>After two hours a 61-year-old man surrendered and was arrested . <p/>Fanning could n't say if anyone else was in the building at the time , but said no one else was injured . <p/>Nigel Hacker said he looked outside his nearby office at about 4:20 p.m. to see the street cordoned off . <p/>`` There was someone in the building and they were trying to get him out , '' Hacker said . <p/>`` I tried not to listen . '' <p/>But he caught the tone of the conversation . <p/>`` It was n't emotional from this end , '' he said . <p/>`` Everything seemed under control . <p/>They did a great job . '' <p/>Down the street at Paperny Films , John Christie said employees were planning to hold an office party upstairs when someone heard shots fired and the police came knocking at their door . <p/>`` We have been asked by the police to stay away from the windows and we 've been forced to go downstairs , '' Christie said . <p/>`` We 're having an office party anyway so we 're just staying out of the way , undercover . <p/>If we 're in a lockdown , at least we have beers and pizza . '' <p/>Christie said the police , who placed an undercover officer at Paperny 's front door , were n't pleased when some office workers fled through the back alley to get home . <p/>TallGrass claims it is the fastest-growing natural-health-product supplier to the Natural Health Industry in Canada . <p/>It was originally called Tallgrass Hemp Company , and supplied a variety of products based on the hemp plant , including Body Dope , a line of hair- and skin-care products made with hemp and other botanicals .

text: Woman Killed in Queens Hit - And - Run , Police Arrest Allegedly Drunk Driver
marked_sentence: Woman Killed in Queens Hit - And - Run , Police Arrest Allegedly <mark id="mark_id"> Drunk </mark> Driver
marked_doc: http : / / www . dnainfo . com / new - york / 20130914 / richmond - hill / woman - killed - queens - hit - and - run - police - arrest - allegedly - drunk - driver <p/>Woman Killed in Queens Hit - And - Run , Police Arrest Allegedly <mark id="mark_id"> Drunk </mark> Driver <p/>on September 14 , 2013 11 : 41am | Updated on September 14 , 2013 11 : 41am <p/>An allegedly intoxicated driver who tried to flee after striking and fatally injuring a woman in Queens has been charged in her murder , according to police . <p/>Police responded to the Richmond Hill crash on the corner of 117th Street and 97th Avenue at 7 : 01 p . m . on Friday to find the unconscious Raj K . Chohan , 59 , of College Point , lying in the roadway , the NYPD said . <p/>EMS crews rushed Chohan to Jamaica Hospital for treatment , where she was later pronounced dead . <p/>An initial investigation of the scene revealed that Chohan had been walking alongside the parked cars on 117th Street when she was struck by a vehicle heading northbound , police said . <p/>The driver took off after the accident , but witnesses identified the vehicle as a grey 2013 Toyota Camry and Vishwanand Subryan , 23 , of Schenectady , was identified and arrested not far from the scene , police said . <p/>Subryan was charged with criminally negligent homicide , vehicular manslaughter , leaving the scene of an accident resulting in death , and driving while intoxicated . <p/>An investigation into the crime is still ongoing , police said .

text: Authorities have released the name of a 66-year-old woman who was walking outside the Sam 's Club in Bloomington when she was struck and killed by a motorist .
marked_sentence: Authorities have released the name of a 66-year-old woman who was walking outside the Sam 's Club in Bloomington when she was struck and <mark id="mark_id"> killed </mark> by a motorist .
marked_doc: Authorities have released the name of a 66-year-old woman who was walking outside the Sam 's Club in Bloomington when she was struck and <mark id="mark_id"> killed </mark> by a motorist . <p/>Police identified the victim on Thursday as LuAnn Marie Johnson of Burnsville . <p/>Johnson was walking in a crosswalk outside the store when she was struck around 7 p.m. Wednesday . <p/>Police say a man outside the Sam 's Club told the 36-year-old driver to stop but he kept going . <p/>Police pulled him over a few blocks away and say they had to Taser him to get him out of the car . <p/>The woman was pronounced dead at HCMC .

marked_doc: http : / / www . tsn . ca / mma / story / ? id=265672 <p/>CHARGERS' WILLIAMS ARRESTED ON SUSPICION OF DUI <p/>2 / 3 / 2009 5 : 59 : 13 PM <p/>San Diego Chargers defensive tackle Jamal Williams was arrested on suspicion of drunk driving , the team's second such arrest in less than a month . <p/>Williams was <mark id="mark_id"> pulled over </mark> for speeding early Sunday on a freeway outside the city's downtown area , the California Highway Patrol said . <p/>Williams gave a blood sample for a blood - alcohol test , but the results were not yet known . <p/>Williams was booked into county jail and later released on bail . <p/>The City Attorney's office said the case hadn't been submitted as of Tuesday . <p/>Chargers general manager A . text: The Indian Navy on Saturday prevented pirates from attacking a merchant vessel flying an Ethiopian flag in the Gulf of Aden and took 23 into custody .

marked_doc: The Indian Navy on Saturday prevented pirates from <mark id="mark_id"> attacking </mark> a merchant vessel flying an Ethiopian flag in the Gulf of Aden and took 23 into custody . <p/>Responding to a distress call by MV Gibe , INS Mysore on anti-piracy patrol in the area , swung into action against the pirates in two boats , a Defence Ministry release said . <p/>The apprehended included 12 Somalis and 11 Yemenis. Seven AK-47s , three other automatic rifles , 13 loaded magazines , a rocket-propelled grenade-launcher , rockets , cartridges and grenades were found in the boats . <p/>There were also three outboard motors and a global positioning system receiver . <p/>The personnel , arms , ammunition and equipment would be handed over to appropriate authorities ashore . <p/>The Ministry said MV Gibe put out a message at 1100 hours that it was under attack from two boats closing in on it and firing small arms . <p/>The merchant vessel retaliated with small arms onboard . <p/>The warship some 13 nautical miles away , altered course and launched its integral armed helicopter . <p/>On sighting the warship and the helicopter , the pirates attempted to escape . <p/>INS Mysore closed in and ordered them to stop . <p/>The larger boat , a dhow was identified as Salahuddin , with the second smaller boat in tow . <p/>Marine commandos boarded the dhow at 1230 hours and apprehended the pirates and recovered the arms , ammunition and equipment . <p/>PTI reports: <p/>Last month , Navy warship INS Tabar , a missile-frigate , had sunk a mother ship of the pirates and had also rescued two merchant vessels under attack . <p/>On November 19 , INS Tabar sunk a fishing trawler that was under the control of pirates , in a third successive strike since its deployment on November 2 this year .

text: Shooting at Accounting Firm Leaves Woman Dead and 2 Hurt
marked_sentence: Shooting at Accounting Firm <mark id="mark_id"> Leaves </mark> Woman Dead and 2 Hurt
marked_doc: http : / / www . nytimes . com / 2007 / 04 / 10 / us / 10revenge . html ? _ r=0 <p/>Shooting at Accounting Firm <mark id="mark_id"> Leaves </mark> Woman Dead and 2 Hurt <p/>Published : April 10 , 2007 <p/>A man who was fired last week from his job at an accounting firm in suburban Detroit walked into his former office with a shotgun on Monday and shot three people , killing one , before fleeing and leading police officers on a high - speed chase , the authorities said . <p/>The suspect , identified as Anthony LaCalamita , entered the second - floor office of the accounting firm , Gordon Advisors , about 10 a . m . and opened fire , the police said . <p/>A 63 - year - old woman and two men , ages 47 and 48 , were shot , the police said . <p/>The woman , identified by the police as Madeline Kafoury , died at the scene , the authorities said . <p/>The two other victims were being treated at Beaumont Hospital in Royal Oak . <p/>Ilene Wolff , a spokeswoman for the hospital , said that their families had requested privacy , and that the hospital was not releasing any information about their condition or the nature of their injuries . <p/>Though the police declined to release the names of the two men , The Detroit Free Press identified them as Paul Riva , 47 , of Sterling Heights and Alan Steinberg , 48 , of Bruce Township . <p/>Both are partners in the firm , the newspaper reported . <p/>Mr . LaCalamita , 38 , who was still listed on the firm ’ s Web site as a member of its “ professional staff , ” had been dismissed last week , the police said . <p/>Though they would not say what his relationship was with any of the victims or what led to the shootings , “ it doesn ’ t appear it was random , ” the Troy police chief , Charles Craft , said . <p/>Officers and witnesses described a chaotic scene immediately after the shooting as workers barricaded themselves in their cubicles and offices . <p/>A few hours later , some employees gathered outside the building but would not speak to reporters . <p/>The three - story office building houses other tenants in addition to the accounting firm , and appeared to have no formal security system , Chief Craft said . <p/>He said witnesses told the police that Mr . LaCalamita had walked into the building and into the firm ’ s unlocked suite as though he were concealing something . <p/>Mr . LaCalamita fled in his car before officers arrived , but witnesses took note of the license plate number , the authorities said . <p/>About two hours after the shooting , officers received a tip from a motorist in Flint , about 50 miles north of here , on the whereabouts of the car . <p/>Police officers chased Mr . LaCalamita for about 30 miles at speeds of up to 120 miles an hour on Interstate 75 before apprehending him near Bay City .

text: A fired accountant bought a shotgun the day after he lost his job , then returned to the office the following week and opened fire on his bosses , wounding both and killing a receptionist , the Associated Press reported .
marked_sentence: A fired accountant bought a shotgun the day after he lost his job , then <mark id="mark_id"> returned </mark> to the office the following week and opened fire on his bosses , wounding both and killing a receptionist , the Associated Press reported .
marked_doc: http : / / www . accountingweb . com / topic / watchdog / fired - accountant - goes - shooting - spree <p/>Fired Accountant Goes on Shooting Spree <p/>on Apr 12 2007 <p/>A fired accountant bought a shotgun the day after he lost his job , then <mark id="mark_id"> returned </mark> to the office the following week and opened fire on his bosses , wounding both and killing a receptionist , the Associated Press reported . <p/>Troy , Mich . police said Anthony LaCalamita III , 38 , targeted two managers and also may have intended to shoot another one . <p/>"There is a suspicion that there might have been a third upper management official he was seeking , " said Troy police Lt . Gerry Scherlinck . <p/>The man , whom police did not identify , was not in the office at the time of the attack . <p/>LaCalamita had been fired last Thursday as a general accountant at the firm and bought a shotgun and shells on Friday , Scherlinck said . <p/>He said police found a box consistent with one that would hold a shotgun , as well as empty shell boxes , in a Dumpster outside LaCalamita's apartment Monday evening . <p/>When LaCalamita was arrested , police said they found a 12 - gauge pump - action shotgun and three shells in his vehicle . <p/>Scherlinck said LaCalamita had been denied a handgun permit in March but it wasn't clear why . <p/>Anthony LaCalamita III , 38 , had been arrested following a high - speed chase shortly after the Monday morning shootings at Gordon Advisors in suburban Detroit . <p/>During LaCalamita's arraignment , authorities described what witnesses saw inside the accounting firm's offices that morning . <p/>LaCalamita walked in around 10 a . m . , stopped briefly at the reception desk , then entered Alan Steinberg's office with the shotgun , Troy police Sgt . Barry Whiteside testified . <p/>Steinberg , a partner in the firm , later told police LaCalamita loaded a shell into the shotgun's chamber and fired at him , hitting him in the hip area . <p/>He then walked toward the office of Paul Riva , another partner . <p/>Receptionist Madeline Kafoury was standing in the doorway of Riva's office , and the gunman fatally shot her in the midsection , Whiteside said . <p/>LaCalamita shot Riva in the upper chest , then left the building , Whiteside said . <p/>He was gone when officers swarmed the office building and began evacuating other workers , then was arrested a few hours later after a chase on a nearby interstate . <p/>Riva had yet to regain consciousness Wednesday and was on a ventilator , police said . <p/>LaCalamita is charged with first - degree murder in the death of Kafoury , 63 , and intent to murder in the shootings of Riva , 47 , and Steinberg , 48 . <p/>He also is charged with possession of a firearm in the commission of a felony and fleeing and eluding police . <p/>A not guilty plea was entered on LaCalamita's behalf during the hearing . <p/>Asked by the judge if he understood the charges against him and if he was aware that he could be sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole if convicted of first - degree murder , he responded "Yes . " <p/>The judge ordered him held without bail pending his next court hearing April 19 . <p/>The judge said he would appoint a lawyer for LaCalamita . <p/>He did not have a representative in court Wednesday . <p/>LaCalamita is married , but his wife , Michele , released a statement saying they had been separated for about three weeks . <p/>According to real estate records obtained by The Associated Press , the couple during the past year actively bought and sold suburban homes . <p/>Records list Michele LaCalamita as the owner of all four . <p/>Riva and Steinberg were being treated at Beaumont Hospital , where spokeswoman Ilene Wolff said the families of the wounded men asked that their conditions and other information not be released .

text: The Academy of Motion Pictures Arts and Sciences , which hands out the world 's top film honors , said Jackman , 40 , star of the romantic epic `` Australia , '' will host the televised ceremony for the first time .
marked_sentence: The Academy of Motion Pictures Arts and Sciences , which hands out the world 's top film <mark id="mark_id"> honors </mark> , said Jackman , 40 , star of the romantic epic `` Australia , '' will host the televised ceremony for the first time .
marked_doc: Australian actor Hugh Jackman was named on Friday as host of February 's Oscars in a departure from the tradition of picking U.S. comedians on Hollywood 's most prestigious night . <p/>The Academy of Motion Pictures Arts and Sciences , which hands out the world 's top film <mark id="mark_id"> honors </mark> , said Jackman , 40 , star of the romantic epic `` Australia , '' will host the televised ceremony for the first time . <p/>The actor , who also starred in the three `` X-Men '' movies and is an award-winning musical theater performer , has hosted Broadway 's Tony awards three times and last month was named 2008 's `` sexiest man alive '' by People magazine . <p/>`` Hugh Jackman is a consummate entertainer and an internationally renowned movie star , '' said Laurence Mark and Bill Condon , the new producers of the televised show . <p/>`` He also has style , elegance and a sense of occasion . <p/>Hugh is the ideal choice to host a celebration of the year 's movies -- and to have fun doing it , '' the pair said in a statement . <p/>Oscar nominations for the best movies and performances of 2008 will be announced in January . <p/>The awards will be handed out on February 22 by the Academy at the Kodak Theater in Hollywood and will be televised in the United States by the ABC network . <p/>Jackman 's choice heralds a new direction for the 81st Oscar ceremony after recent years of falling TV ratings . <p/>Typically , the program has been hosted by U.S. comedians , and in recent years , show organizers have experimented with a variety of hosting styles ranging from political satirist Jon Stewart , to edgy Chris Rock and popular Ellen DeGeneres . <p/>Mark and Condon have axed the famous opening monologue for the February 2009 show , hoping for more spontaneity overall . <p/>They said there may be a stronger element of music and dancing than previously . <p/>`` We want it to be more of a party and a celebration and a departure from the late-night talk-show format , '' Mark told Reuters . <p/>Mark and Condon have a background in musicals and worked together on the 2006 film hit `` Dreamgirls '' . <p/>Jackman , who can sing and dance , was `` genuinely thrilled '' at the offer , Mark said , but `` he wanted to make sure the format would mesh with his skills . '' <p/>The February 2008 three-hour plus broadcast , hosted for the second time by Stewart , hit a low 32 million U.S. viewers and entered the record books as the least-watched Oscars ever . <p/>Still , even an audience of that size makes the telecast annually one of the most-watched U.S. TV shows . <p/>The broadcast also is televised live in more than 200 countries worldwide . <p/>Mark said he and Condon planned to get the telecast under three hours , yet still keep the live presentations of awards and acceptance speeches .

text: Indian Navy foils attack in Gulf of Aden , nabs 26 pirates

marked_doc: http : / / www . defence . pk / forums / indian - defence / 140085 - indian - navy - foils - attack - gulf - aden - nabs - 26 - pirates . html <p/>Indian Navy foils <mark id="mark_id"> attack </mark> in Gulf of Aden , nabs 26 pirates <p/>Mumbai , Nov 11 - <p/>Indian Navy patrolling the Gulf of Aden yesterday thwarted a multi - boat attack by sea brigands on merchant vessels , apprehending 26 Somali pirates and confiscating arms and ammunition , in the fifth successful anti - piracy operation since September . <p/>At about 9 : 25 Thursday morning , navy personnel aboard warship INS Sukanya spotted a group of five suspicious boats speedily approaching the merchant vessels of her group . <p/>"The warship immediately altered ( its direction ) towards the suspicious vessels and challenged them . <p/>On seeing the resolve evident in the warship's action and probably mindful of the reputation for resolute action that the Indian Navy justly enjoys in such deployments , the pirate skiffs reversed course and tried to flee the area , " Captain Manohar Nambiar , Chief Public Relations Officer , Defence , said . <p/>While two of them managed to escape , INS Sukanya successfully intercepted the remaining three boats and , in a well - practiced and professionally executed boarding - and - search action , nabbed 26 Somali pirates with six AK 47 rifles , 12 magazines and about 300 rounds of ammunition . <p/>This is the fifth successful anti - piracy operation conducted by INS Sukanya in the course of her ongoing patrol mission in the Gulf of Aden that commenced in September , the navy said . <p/>Warship Sukanya , currently deployed on anti - piracy patrols in the Gulf of Aden under the operational control of the Western Naval Command , was escorting a group of five merchant vessels through the Internationally Recognised Transit Corridor when the incident happened . <p/>The timely operation by INS Sukanya resulted , once again , in foiling the pirates' attempt to attack merchant vessels transiting the busy sea lane through which over nearly 100 billion USD worth India's external trade passes each year , Nambiar said . <p/>In their five operations so far , the personnel on board the warship have confiscated 14 AK - 47 Rifles , 31 magazines and 923 rounds of ammunition , he said . <p/>Indian Navy is part of the international effort to ensure the safety and freedom of seaborne trade in this high - risk stronghold of modern - day piracy .

text: An arrest for suspicion of driving under the influence will not affect the playing status of San Diego Chargers wide receiver Vincent Jackson for Sunday 's divisional playoff game at Pittsburgh .
marked_sentence: An arrest for suspicion of <mark id="mark_id"> driving under the influence </mark> will not affect the playing status of San Diego Chargers wide receiver Vincent Jackson for Sunday 's divisional playoff game at Pittsburgh .
marked_doc: Chargers WR Jackson will play vs. Steelers <p/>An arrest for suspicion of <mark id="mark_id"> driving under the influence </mark> will not affect the playing status of San Diego Chargers wide receiver Vincent Jackson for Sunday 's divisional playoff game at Pittsburgh . <p/>Jackson was arrested on the DUI charge early Tuesday morning by the California Highway Patrol . <p/>However , the fourth-year wide receiver likely will not face disciplinary action until the 2009 season . <p/>An NFL spokesman on Wednesday said the league will await a determination by the court before considering disciplinary action against Jackson . <p/>Along with the misdemeanor DUI allegation , California Highway Patrol Officer Brad Baehr said Jackson was cited for driving on probation for a prior DUI . <p/>Jackson issued a statement released through the team . <p/>`` I was stopped by an officer , '' he said . <p/>`` I do n't think any charges will be filed as a result of the stop . <p/>In the event they are , I look forward to clearing my name and proving my innocence . '' <p/>Baehr said he was not aware of the particulars of the previous DUI charge and that results of Jackson 's blood test are pending . <p/>Jackson had his finest season in 2008 with with 59 receptions for 1,098 yards and seven touchdowns for the AFC West champions . <p/>`` We 're aware of the off-the-field issue involving Vincent , '' team general manager A.J. Smith said in a statement . <p/>`` Obviously we 're disappointed . <p/>We take these issues very seriously . <p/>Moving forward , we will monitor the situation and have no further comment . ''

text: Philadelphia 76ers Fire Coach Jim O'Brien , Hire Maurice Cheeks
marked_sentence: Philadelphia 76ers <mark id="mark_id"> Fire </mark> Coach Jim O'Brien , Hire Maurice Cheeks
marked_doc: http : / / www . insidehoops . com / obrien - cheeks - 052305 . shtml <p/>Philadelphia 76ers <mark id="mark_id"> Fire </mark> Coach Jim O'Brien , Hire Maurice Cheeks <p/>May 23 , 2005 <p/>Philadelphia 76ers President and General Manager Billy King announced today that Jim O'Brien has been relieved of his duties as head coach of the Philadelphia 76ers . <p/>No decision has been reached on O'Brien's staff at this time . <p/>O'Brien was hired as the 20th coach of the 76ers on April 21 , 2004 and posted a record of 43 - 39 in 2004 - 05 . <p/>Overall , in five seasons as an NBA head coach , O'Brien recorded a mark of 182 - 158 ( . 535 ) , including a record of 139 - 119 ( . 539 ) with the Boston Celtics from 2000 - 04 . <p/>O'Brien has served on the coaching staffs at seven different universities , including head coaching positions at Wheeling Jesuit College ( 1982 - 87 ) and University of Dayton ( 1989 - 94 ) . <p/>He owns a 135 - 156 ( . 464 ) record at the collegiate level in 10 seasons as a head coach . <p/>Also today , Philadelphia 76ers President and General Manager Billy King announced that Maurice Cheeks has been hired as the 21st head coach of the Philadelphia 76ers . <p/>Cheeks arrives in Philadelphia after three - plus seasons as head coach of the Portland Trail Blazers . <p/>He recorded a mark of 162 - 139 ( . 538 ) in Portland , the fourth - highest win total in Blazers history . <p/>During his time in Portland , the Blazers reached the NBA Playoffs twice , and his 2002 - 03 squad tied for second in the Pacific Division with a 50 - 32 record . <p/>He joined the Blazers on June 27 , 2001 , after serving seven seasons as an assistant coach for the 76ers . <p/>Cheeks worked under head coaches John Lucas ( 1994 - 96 ) , Johnny Davis ( 1996 - 97 ) , and Larry Brown ( 1997 - 2001 ) . <p/>In 2000 - 01 under Brown , Cheeks helped guide the 76ers to a record of 56 - 26 ( . 683 ) and a spot in the NBA Finals . <p/>Cheeks , 48 , logged an impressive 15 - year NBA career , spending 11 seasons in Philadelphia . <p/>The four - time All - Star ( 1983 , '86 , '87 , '88 ) helped guide the 76ers to 10 playoff appearances , including a World Championship in 1983 . <p/>In 133 career playoff games , he averaged 14 . 4 points , 6 . 9 assists , and 3 . 4 rebounds while shooting 51 . 2 percent from the field . <p/>Cheeks is also a five - time NBA All - Defensive Team honoree . <p/>The native of Chicago , Ill . , he averaged 11 . 1 points , 6 . 7 assists and 2 . 1 steals in 1 , 101 career games while shooting 52 . 3 percent from the field and 79 . 3 percent from the charity stripe . <p/>He retired in 1993 as the league's all - time leader in steals , and was fifth on the career assists list at that time . <p/>Currently , he ranks fourth in steals and eighth in assists all - time . <p/>Cheeks had his No . 10 76ers jersey retired on Feb . 6 , 1995 . <p/>The 1978 product of West Texas State was a four - year starter and three - time team MVP in college . <p/>He finished his collegiate career third on the Buffalos' all - time scoring list , averaging 16 . 8 points per game . <p/>Cheeks was selected in the second round of the 1978 NBA Draft ( 36th overall pick ) by the 76ers .

text: A former employee who opened fire at an office Christmas party killing one man , has been charged with first-degree murder , police said Saturday .
marked_sentence: A former employee who opened fire at an office Christmas <mark id="mark_id"> party </mark> killing one man , has been charged with first-degree murder , police said Saturday .
marked_doc: A former employee who opened fire at an office Christmas <mark id="mark_id"> party </mark> killing one man , has been charged with first-degree murder , police said Saturday . <p/>Constable Tim Fanning allege the recently-fired man , Eric Allen Kirkpatrick , 61 , opened fire at a Vancouver office Friday , killing Benjamin David Banky , 40 . <p/>Fanning said the gunman , entered the party of at least a dozen people around 4:00 p.m . <p/>One man was shot and killed but the other partygoers managed to escape and no one else was injured . <p/>`` Police 'locked down ' the neighborhood and negotiated with the suspect , who gave himself up to police just after 6:00 p.m. , '' Fanning said in a statement . <p/>The business at the location of the shooting is listed as TallGrass Distribution Ltd. , a natural health product supplier . <p/>Luke Pigeon , who lives in an apartment building next door , said he did n't hear a gunshot but heard noise outside his window . <p/>`` It was n't typical , crazy noise that sometimes happens . <p/>You got the feeling there was something definitely , definitely wrong , `` Pigeon told The Canadian Press . <p/>He looked out his window and saw someone fleeing the building next door . <p/>`` All of a sudden in my front yard there were five totally decked out , geared up riot squad officers with guns out of the holster , aiming at the second floor of the building right beside us , '' Pigeon said . <p/>After two hours , he said , the gunman gave himself up and police cuffed him .

Cook National Park were not related and were not due to bad weather . <p/>He said they come as a reminder that climbers need to use extreme caution . <p/>On Friday , 36 - year - old Duncan Rait died after slipping and falling about 60m from a ridge near the Tasman Glacier . <p/>The New Zealand - born Australian was planning to do some ski touring . <p/>He'd been dropped off by helicopter with a group and was walking to a hut when he fell , sliding down a steep slope and over a cliff . <p/>Gaskin said that other climbers attempted to rescue Rait by taking him down the glacier , but that he died on the way down . <p/>On Saturday , 32 - year - old Englishman Robert Buckley <mark id="mark_id"> fell </mark> about 600m while climbing to a small hut on Mount Sefton with three companions . <p/>Gaskin said Buckley was wearing crampons but was inexperienced .

text: Now that it 's been confirmed that Hugh Jackman will be hosting the 81st Annual Academy Awards , instantly upping the annual ceremony 's overall attractiveness , the Ampersand would like to offer some heartfelt advice to the first-time Oscar host .
marked_sentence: Now that it 's been confirmed that Hugh Jackman will be hosting the 81st Annual Academy Awards , instantly upping the annual ceremony 's overall attractiveness , the Ampersand would like to <mark id="mark_id"> offer </mark> some heartfelt advice to the first-time Oscar host .
marked_doc: Now that it 's been confirmed that Hugh Jackman will be hosting the 81st Annual Academy Awards , instantly upping the annual ceremony 's overall attractiveness , the Ampersand would like to <mark id="mark_id"> offer </mark> some heartfelt advice to the first-time Oscar host . <p/>True , Jackman held his own just fine as the host of both the 2004 and 2005 Tony Awards , earning an Emmy for the former , but this is a whole new ballgame . <p/>So without further ado , Hugh , a list of dos and don'ts when hosting the Academy Awards: <p/>DO Keep jokes tight , snappy and to-the-point , a la Jon Stewart . <p/>Stewart pulled off a television miracle last year when he hosted the 2007 Oscars only 11 days after the WGA writer 's strike ended , meaning that his jokes and opening speech were last-minute writes . <p/>This did n't seem to dampen Stewart 's usual comedic flair . <p/>Keeping a constant string of quick ( and often political ) one-liners coming at the audience , who had to keep on their toes so as not to miss anything , he made sure that the ceremonies did n't get bogged down , keeping things lively . <p/>My personal favourite quip: <p/>`` Oscar is 80 this year , which makes him now automatically the front-runner for the Republican nomination . '' <p/>A `` John McCain is so old '' joke is never in bad taste ! <p/>Stewart also oozed confidence , despite lackluster reviews of his hosting job in 2006 . <p/>DO Channel Johnny Carson . <p/>Carson is considered the epitome of the Oscar host . <p/>He hosted the ceremony five times and found that magical place where a joke is just biting enough , but does n't sting . <p/>`` I see some new faces here , especially on the old ones , '' he joked in one opening speech . <p/>See ? <p/>Slightly scathing , but playful . <p/>After all , the last thing you want to do is piss off your entire industry . <p/>DO Allow yourself to get star-struck . <p/>Even the Hollywood heavy-weights that host the Oscars are allowed to be overwhelmed by the folks the statuettes are being presented to . <p/>While obviously a part of her act , there was something very endearing about Ellen DeGeneres pausing in her host spiel to snap a Myspace picture of her and Clint Eastwood and letting the audience know what a thrill the experience of hosting for them was . <p/>Nothing 's going to get the audience on your side like admitting they they impress you . <p/>DO Go Big . <p/>Hollywood has never been about self-restraint or simplicity . <p/>When celebrating the movie industry you 've got to be lavish . <p/>While Jackman has a certain composed air about him and oozes class ( have you seen a picture of him in a tux ? ) he could benefit from a spectacular entrance like Whoopi Goldberg 's in 1999 ( she waltzed on stage in full Queen Elizabeth get-up ) . <p/>It 's Hollywood : go big , baby . <p/>DO Watch the time <p/>Since the introduction of the play-off music that cuts award recipients off when they get too long-winded ( is there anything more embarrassing than watching an A-lister chase the microphone as its lowered into the stage in order to get that last thank-you in ? ) , the Oscars have been trimmer in recent years . <p/>But just as dangerous as the ceremony going over is it running short . <p/>It happened in 1959 . <p/>Then host Jerry Lewis forced that year 's winners to dance awkwardly around the stage in order to fill the last twenty minutes of his broadcast . <p/>Mortifying . <p/>Avoid at all costs . <p/>DO N'T Appropriate . <p/>It will always be funny when Billy Crystal relives the year 's greatest films ( or rather , dodges certain death within them ) in an intricate opening montage . <p/>He 's done it eight times already and it has yet to get old . <p/>That being said , it 's Crystal 's thing . <p/>Jackman will have to come up with his own trademark hosting quirk . <p/>Might I suggest flashy , high-kicking song and dance numbers ? <p/>DO N'T Do anything that David Letterman did . <p/>Enough said . <p/>DO N'T Be afraid to be abusive or controversial . <p/>While no one ever wants to see a repeat of Michael Moore 's rant in 2001 , it 's the snippy , daring jokes and comments that are remembered , like Steve Martin 's improvistation right after the aforementioned tirade .

text: The Indian navy captured 23 piracy suspects who tried to take over a merchant vessel in the Gulf of Aden , between the Horn of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula , Indian officials said .
marked_sentence: The Indian navy captured 23 piracy suspects who tried to take over a merchant vessel in the Gulf of Aden , between the Horn of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula , Indian officials <mark id="mark_id"> said </mark> .
marked_doc: The Indian navy captured 23 piracy suspects who tried to take over a merchant vessel in the Gulf of Aden , between the Horn of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula , Indian officials <mark id="mark_id"> said </mark> . <p/>Piracy suspects raise their hands in surrender as an Indian navy boat approaches . <p/>In addition to the 12 Somali and 11 Yemeni suspects , the Indian navy seized two small boats and `` a substantial cache of arms and equipment , '' the military said in a statement . <p/>Among the seized items were seven AK-47 automatic rifles , three other automatic weapons and 13 loaded magazines ; a rocket-propelled grenade launcher along with rockets , cartridges and grenades ; up to three outboard motors and a global positioning system receiver . <p/>Pirate attacks in the waters off Somalia have increased this year , with armed men staging increasingly bold attacks on ever-larger targets . <p/>This year , pirates have attacked nearly 100 vessels off Somalia 's coast and hijacked nearly 40 , the International Maritime Bureau said . <p/>The Indian warship Mysore , which carried out Saturday 's operation , is on anti-piracy patrol in the Gulf of Aden , the release said . <p/>The Mysore received a distress call Saturday morning from the MV Gibe , a merchant vessel sailing under an Ethiopian flag . <p/>The Gibe reported that two boats were firing small arms at it . <p/>The merchant ship , which was 13 nautical miles from the Mysore , fired back with small arms onboard the vessel . <p/>The Mysore changed course toward the Gibe and launched an armed helicopter , the Indian military said . <p/>Upon seeing the helicopter and the Mysore closing in , the attackers broke off and tried to flee , the release said . <p/>The warship caught up to the boats , the larger of which was described as a 24- to 30-foot dhow , a traditional Arab sailboat . <p/>The dhow , identified as bearing the name Salahaddin , was towing a smaller skiff . <p/>Indian sailors boarded the Salahaddin , the military said , and the 23 suspects surrendered peacefully . <p/>The suspects , weapons , ammunition and equipment will be handed over to authorities , and the Mysore will return to patrol duties , India said . <p/>Last month , the Indian navy said it had sunk a pirate `` mother vessel '' in the Gulf of Aden . <p/>The ship 's owner said the sunken vessel was a Thai trawler that was being seized by pirates when an Indian warship fired on it . <p/>Sixteen crew members were aboard the ship , said Wicharn Sirichaiekawat , owner of the Ekawat Nava 5 . <p/>Two have been accounted for . <p/>One crewman was found alive after six days adrift in the Gulf of Aden , and one is confirmed dead , the ship 's owner said . <p/>Indian authorities insisted that their ship , the frigate INS Tabar , had acted against a pirate vessel that had threatened to attack it . <p/>`` We fired in self-defense and in response to firing upon our vessel , '' Commodore Nirad Sinha , a navy spokesman , told CNN . <p/>`` It was a pirate vessel in the international waters , and its stance was aggressive . '' <p/>He said the ship the Tabar fired on was laden with ammunition . <p/>All sorts of vessels -- freight and cargo ships , cruise liners and private yachts -- have been attacked in the waters off Somalia . <p/>In many hijackings , pirates take the crew and passengers hostage and demand a ransom . <p/>Just this month , Somali pirates captured two Yemeni fishing boats and 22 Yemeni fishermen in the Gulf of Aden , Yemen 's official news agency SABA reported . <p/>A day earlier , the German cruise liner MS Columbus said it would fly its 246 passengers and most of its crew over the Gulf of Aden instead of through it to avoid any pirate attack . <p/>The United States is reportedly circulating a proposal in the U.N. Security Council that would allow military forces to enter Somali territory in `` hot pursuit '' of pirates . <p/>The Pentagon said Friday , however , that there are no plans for U.S. forces to go ashore in pursuit of pirates in Somalia .

47 Rifles , 31 magazines and 923 rounds of ammunition , he said . <p/>Indian Navy is part of the international effort to ensure the safety and freedom of seaborne trade in this high - risk stronghold of modern - day piracy .

text: Sheriff : Michigan office shooting kills 1 , injures 2
marked_sentence: Sheriff : Michigan office shooting kills 1 , <mark id="mark_id"> injures </mark> 2
marked_doc: http : / / edition . cnn . com / 2007 / US / 04 / 09 / michigan . shooting / <p/>Sheriff : Michigan office shooting kills 1 , <mark id="mark_id"> injures </mark> 2 <p/>POSTED : 1052 GMT ( 1852 HKT ) , April 10 , 2007 <p/>A Michigan man shot to death one person and injured two others Monday at the suburban Detroit accounting firm from which he was fired last week , police said . <p/>The suspect , 38 - year - old Anthony LaCalamita , was "deliberately seeking out these individuals , " according to Troy police Lt . Gerry Scherlinck . <p/>A female receptionist died and two men , believed to be "management level employees , " underwent surgery for gunshot wounds at Royal Oak Beaumont Hospital , Scherlinck said . <p/>A 50 - year - old man from Dexter , Michigan , tipped off authorities to LaCalamita's location after hearing a description of the suspect's vehicle - - a 2007 silver Ford Fusion - - on the radio . <p/>The man , who did not want to be identified , called 911 when he realized the vehicle directly next to him matched the description on the radio , according to Genesee County Sheriff Robert Pickell . <p/>Police attempted to stop the vehicle as it entered Vienna township , but LaCalamita would not pull over , Pickell said . <p/>LaCalamita drove across several counties , at speeds up to 120 miles per hour , surrendering only after authorities boxed in his car on Interstate 75 in Saginaw , Michigan . <p/>He surrendered "peacefully and without incident , " Pickell said . <p/>Upon arrest , police seized a shotgun and several shells , he said . <p/>LaCalamita is being held in the Genesee County jail and is expected to be handed over to the Detroit police . <p/>A Web site for the public accounting firm Gordon Advisors in the building lists LaCalamita as an employee . <p/>"We heard gunshots . . . . <p/>We're on the third floor , barricaded in , " Bill Adgate , who works for LPL Financial in the office building , told CNN affiliate WDIV - TV as the search went on for the gunman . <p/>"We put a conference table in front of the front door with a bunch of chairs , " Adgate told WDIV , a Detroit station . <p/>"We have four entrances - - three entrances to our offices . <p/>We put file cabinets and things of that nature in front of it . " <p/>Monday's shooting follows two last week in public places in Atlanta , Georgia , and Seattle , Washington . <p/>In Atlanta's CNN Center on Tuesday , police say a man shot to death his former girlfriend just downstairs from the center's Omni Hotel and outside the CNN . com newsroom . <p/>On Monday on the Seattle campus of the University of Washington , a gunman killed his former girlfriend and then himself . <p/>In early March , a gunman shot and wounded three people at a printing facility near Los Angeles , California , before killing himself . <p/>Police said he was a disgruntled employee of the facility in Signal Hill , California . <p/>In February , a gunman killed five people and injured several others at a shopping mall in Salt Lake City , Utah , before an off - duty policeman killed the shooter .

text: Comedian Ellen DeGeneres will make her second appearance as an Academy Awards host next year , organizers said on Friday , in a move widely seen as a less provocative choice for Hollywood's highest honors after a ribald performance by Seth MacFarlane .
marked_sentence: Comedian Ellen DeGeneres will make her second appearance as an Academy Awards <mark id="mark_id"> host </mark> next year , organizers said on Friday , in a move widely seen as a less provocative choice for Hollywood's highest honors after a ribald performance by Seth MacFarlane .
marked_doc: http : / / www . reuters . com / article / 2013 / 08 / 02 / us - oscars - degeneres - idUSBRE9710UQ20130802 <p/>Comedian Ellen DeGeneres picked to host 2014 Oscars <p/>Fri Aug 2 , 2013 6 : 50pm EDT <p/>Comedian Ellen DeGeneres will make her second appearance as an Academy Awards <mark id="mark_id"> host </mark> next year , organizers said on Friday , in a move widely seen as a less provocative choice for Hollywood's highest honors after a ribald performance by Seth MacFarlane . <p/>DeGeneres , the star of her own daytime talk show "Ellen , " first hosted the Oscars in 2007 , becoming only the second woman to fill that exalted role alone , after Whoopi Goldberg . <p/>"I am so excited to be hosting the Oscars for the second time , " DeGeneres said in a statement . <p/>"You know what they say - the third time's the charm . " <p/>"I'd like to thank @TheAcademy , my wife Portia and , oh dear , there goes the orchestra , " the comedian added on Twitter . <p/>DeGeneres , 55 , earned an Emmy nomination for her performance in 2007 in which she departed from traditional Oscar hosting decorum and ventured into the audience for spot gags , at one point handing director Martin Scorsese a script of her own . <p/>"Choosing DeGeneres , known for her kindler , gentler humor , signals that the Academy's next awards show will have a decidedly different tone than the 85th Academy Awards , " trade magazine The Hollywood Reporter wrote . <p/>DeGeneres also earned praise for her performance as the host of TV's Emmy awards in 2001 , which was twice delayed because of the September 11 attacks , memorably lightening the somber mood by asking , "What would bug the Taliban more than seeing a gay woman in a suit surrounded by Jews ? " <p/>The announcement of DeGeneres as host also comes on the heels of Hollywood marketing executive Cheryl Boone Isaacs being elected as the first African American president of the 6 , 000 - member Academy , which has made an effort to diversify its ranks after coming under fire for being too male , old and white . <p/>Trade publication Variety saw the choice of DeGeneres as a continuation of the Academy's "Year of the Woman , " writing that the Oscars "will put women in the driver's seat . "

text: The driver fled the accident scene but was apprehended by police officers .

marked_doc: http : / / www . injurylawofnewyork . com / blog / 2013 / 09 / new - york - woman - killed - in - hit - and - run - crash . shtml <p/>New York woman killed in hit - and - run crash <p/>On behalf of Howard R . Sanders , Esq . posted in Pedestrian Accidents on Wednesday , September 18 , 2013 . <p/>According to investigators , a woman was killed by a hit - and - run driver in Queens on the night of Sept . 13 . <p/>At approximately 7 p . m . , the woman was walking near the intersection of 117th Street and 97th Avenue in Richmond Hill . <p/>She was walking among some parked cars when she was hit by a grey Toyota Camry that had been traveling north on 117th Street . <p/>The driver fled the <mark id="mark_id"> accident </mark> scene but was apprehended by police officers . <p/>The driver was charged with DWI , leaving the scene of an accident resulting in death , criminally negligent homicide and vehicular manslaughter . <p/>A hit - and - run accident may be considered an example of extreme recklessness or carelessness on the part of a driver . <p/>A personal injury attorney might review a hit - and - run accident case and suggest seeking punitive damages . <p/>In some instances , it is possible to collect damages that exceed compensation for lost wages , medical expenses and funeral costs . <p/>The intention is to punish reckless and negligent drivers and also to send a message to other drivers . <p/>If the family wishes to seek only compensation for accident - related expenses , the attorney may negotiate for a settlement outside of court . <p/>On the other hand , if the family decides to seek punitive damages , the attorney might request a jury trial in civil court . <p/>If the at - fault driver was charged or convicted in criminal court , it may help support the claim of recklessness . <p/>The attorney may use police reports , photos and evidence to build a convincing argument on behalf of the family . <p/>If the judge and jury are persuaded by the argument and evidence presented , they may find in favor of the plaintiffs and award punitive damages .

'' <p/>He said the two deaths were not related to weather conditions . <p/>''I can't speak for the first death , but in this case it looks like to be a lack of experience , '' Inspector Gaskin said . <p/>Yesterday , a 36 - year - old Australian climber died after falling about 150 metres at Mt Cook . <p/>The man , from Hampton East , fell in the Tasman Glacier area . <p/>A Westpac Rescue Helicopter from Christchurch was called about 3pm to assist with search and rescue co - ordination at the Mt Cook base . <p/>When it got there , the man had been transported to Mt Cook Village by a local helicopter service and pronounced dead by paramedics . <p/>The man is thought to have fallen much earlier in the day .

text: A five - boat pirate attack on merchant vessels transiting the Gulf of Aden was foiled by an Indian warship that was on escort duty , capturing 26 Somani brigands on three of the skiffs and confiscating their weapons , a naval officer said here Friday .
marked_sentence: A five - boat pirate attack on merchant vessels <mark id="mark_id"> transiting </mark> the Gulf of Aden was foiled by an Indian warship that was on escort duty , capturing 26 Somani brigands on three of the skiffs and confiscating their weapons , a naval officer said here Friday .
marked_doc: http : / / www . bharatwaves . co . in / news / Indian - Navy - foils - another - piracy - attempt - - 26046 . html <p/>A five - boat pirate attack on merchant vessels <mark id="mark_id"> transiting </mark> the Gulf of Aden was foiled by an Indian warship that was on escort duty , capturing 26 Somani brigands on three of the skiffs and confiscating their weapons , a naval officer said here Friday . <p/>Patrol vessel INS Sukanya was escorting the five merchant vessels through the Internationally Recognised Transit Corridor in the Gulf of Aden Thursday morning when the warship's crew noticed the five - boat pirate formation approaching the cargo ship group . <p/>"The warship immediately altered towards the suspicious vessels and challenged them , " the officer said , adding the pirate skiffs then reversed course and tried to flee the area . <p/>"While two of the skiffs and its crew managed to get away , Sukanya successfully intercepted the remaining three skiffs and carried out well - practiced and professionally executed boarding - and - search action . <p/>"The three boats had a total of 26 Somali crew on board . <p/>During the operation , six AK - 47 rifles , 12 magazines and about 300 rounds of ammunition were found and confiscated , " the officer said . <p/>In addition , the naval boarding party also found a host of other equipment such as grapnels , ladders and rope - handling gloves , all of which confirmed their intent to attack and hijack the merchant vessels , he said . <p/>This anti - piracy action by INS Sukanya was the fifth successful operation by its crew during its current patrol mission in the Gulf of Aden since September this year . <p/>INS Sukanya has seized a total of 14 AK - 47 rifles , 31 magazines and 923 rounds of ammunition during the five operations it carried out there , the officer said .
