text: But the 76ers , while underachieving at 9-14 when Cheeks was fired Saturday morning , were not an embarassment when they went on the court , not a disjointed bunch that clearly was no longer listening to or playing for its coach .
marked_sentence: But the 76ers , while underachieving at 9-14 when Cheeks was fired Saturday morning , were not an embarassment when they went on the court , not a disjointed bunch that clearly was no longer <mark id="mark_id"> listening </mark> to or playing for its coach .
marked_doc: Not because Mo Cheeks was long for the job with the Philadelphia 76ers . <p/>Like all coaches not in the upper stratosphere of the coaching hierarchy -- your Phil Jacksons and Gregg Popoviches -- he was only as good as his last 10-game stretch , only as secure as how well his star was playing . <p/>But the 76ers , while underachieving at 9-14 when Cheeks was fired Saturday morning , were not an embarassment when they went on the court , not a disjointed bunch that clearly was no longer <mark id="mark_id"> listening </mark> to or playing for its coach . <p/>This was n't P.J. Carlesimo ( Oklahoma City ) or Eddie Jordan ( Washington ) , whose team 's putrid won-loss records sank any chance they had of survival . <p/>This was n't Sam Mitchell ( Toronto ) , whose differences of opinion with his general manager about his team 's personnel were too big to overcome . <p/>This was n't Randy Wittman ( Minnesota ) , whose fan base was staying away in droves as the paying public grew indifferent to the on-court product . <p/>The timing of this move by team president and general manager Ed Stefanski was a head-scratcher . <p/>`` It 's not 100 percent on the coach , '' a source with knowledge of the 76ers ' thinking said Saturday afternoon . <p/>`` But at the same time , we did n't seem to have a plan . '' <p/>Stefanski named assistant general manager Tony DiLeo coach for the rest of the season . <p/>DiLeo has a good reputation as a coach , spending time over the last two decades on the Sixers ' bench as an assistant and in Europe as a head coach . <p/>But unless circumstances change dramatically , Jordan -- who became close with Stefanski while both were in New Jersey earlier this decade -- will be the odds-on favorite to get the job permanantly . <p/>Many league execs still think quite highly of Jordan , and none of the players who matter in Washington threw Jordan under the bus after he was fired . <p/>Cheeks ' coaching moves have frequently been criticized over the years , both in Philadelphia and in Portland . <p/>But he lost his job this time not only because of Xs and Os , but because so many of the 76ers ' players that blossomed under him last season , including center Sam Dalembert , forward Andre Iguodala and guard Lou Williams , struggled to get going this season . <p/>And the moves Cheeks made , like benching second-year forward Thaddeus Young and elevating guard Willie Green , have n't produced enough dividends . <p/>`` Ed just was n't seeing any progress , '' the source said , and Stefanski expected more from a team that had signed free agent Elton Brand to an $ 82 million deal and re-signed core players Iguodala and Williams for $ 80 million and $ 25 million , respectively . <p/>`` We were n't progressing at the rate [ Stefanski ] thought we should , and he thought it was time for a move , '' the source said . <p/>Yet Stefanski can not escape criticism , either . <p/>Bringing Brand in was the signing coup of the NBA offseason , to be sure . <p/>But in doing that , Stefanski changed the team 's footprint . <p/>The Sixers are still a very good transition team . <p/>But when the game slows down , having to cater to Brand leaves the lane clogged . <p/>Last season , Iguodala , Young and Williams had driving room when Philly ran its halfcourt sets , and Dalembert showed occasional decent low-post play . <p/>But now , Brand is the man in the paint , forcing everyone else out on the perimeter . <p/>Left to fend for himself on the weakside , Dalembert 's numbers have plummeted , and Williams has just begun to play well . <p/>Brand is recovered from the Achilles ' injury that kept him out of all but eight games last season with the Clippers , but he 's been slowed by a bad hamstring , and his offensive numbers ( 15.9 points , a career-low .436 from the floor ) have been unspectactular . <p/>No matter what the stats say , Philly looks and plays slower this season . <p/>And Stefanski did n't get a big-time shooter who could stretch the court and take pressure off of Brand inside . <p/>Veterans Donyell Marshall and Kareem Rush , signed later in the summer by Philly , do n't strike much fear into opposing teams . <p/>The result is Philly 's 93.3 scoring average , 28th in the league ( only Charlotte and Oklahoma City have scored 100 points fewer times than Philadelphia 's six ) , and .314 percentage behind the three-point line , 26th in the league . <p/>`` Everybody zones them , '' an Eastern Conference executive said Saturday . <p/>The Sixers had just scored one of their more impressive victories eight days ago , rallying from a double-digit deficit in the second half to win on the road at Detroit . <p/>True , they had bad losses early to the Bobcats and Timberwolves , and lost a home-and-home to the Cavaliers on Wednesday and Friday . <p/>But last we checked , Cleveland was 20-3 , owner of an 11-game win streak and the only remaining undefeated team at home this season . <p/>The Cavs are rolling , and losing to them is no embarassment . <p/>Another league source with knowledge of the team 's thinking said Saturday that the Cleveland losses played no role in Cheeks 's firing . <p/>Cheeks received his second one-year contract extension in less than a year last September , taking him through the 2009-10 season . <p/>While Stefanski did n't hire Cheeks ( that was former president Billy King , whom Stefanski replaced early last season ) , Stefanski and Cheeks had quickly established a solid , working relationship with one another . <p/>Cheeks quickly acquiesced last year when Stefanski asked him to give more time to the team 's younger players , getting Young and young vets Rodney Carney and Williams bigger minutes . <p/>The transition transformed the team , as the 76ers went on a 19-7 run last spring , turning opponents over and becoming deadly in transition . <p/>They rode their hot streak into the playoffs , where they stretched Detroit to six games before succumbing in the first round . <p/>They were n't a finished product , though , and it was no secret that Brand was Stefanski 's target , just as he 'd been King 's ultimate target . <p/>After a brief dalliance with Atlanta free agent Josh Smith , So Stefanski cleared as much cap room as possible , sending Carney and center Calvin Booth to Minnesota , and then struck , getting Brand to spurn his former team , the Clippers , as well as the Warriors , for the Sixers ' $ 80 million offer -- the `` Sanders , Esq . posted in Pedestrian Accidents on Wednesday , September 18 , 2013 . <p/>According to investigators , a woman was killed by a hit - and - run driver in Queens on the night of Sept . 13 . <p/>At approximately 7 p . m . , the woman was walking near the intersection of 117th Street and 97th Avenue in Richmond Hill . <p/>She was walking among some parked cars when she was hit by a grey Toyota Camry that had been traveling north on 117th Street . <p/>The driver fled the accident scene but was apprehended by police officers . <p/>The driver was charged with DWI , leaving the scene of an accident resulting in death , criminally negligent homicide and vehicular manslaughter . <p/>A hit - and - run accident may be considered an example of extreme recklessness or carelessness on the part of a driver . <p/>A personal injury attorney might review a hit - and - run accident case and suggest seeking punitive damages . <p/>In some instances , it is possible to collect damages that exceed compensation for lost wages , medical expenses and funeral costs . <p/>The intention is to punish reckless and negligent drivers and also to send a message to other drivers . <p/>If the family wishes to seek only compensation for accident - related expenses , the attorney may negotiate for a settlement outside of court . <p/>On the other hand , if the family decides to seek punitive damages , the attorney might request a jury trial in civil court . <p/>If the at - fault driver was charged or convicted in criminal court , it may help support the claim of recklessness . <p/>The attorney may use police reports , photos and evidence to build a convincing argument on behalf of the family . <p/>If the judge and jury are persuaded by the argument and evidence presented , they may find in favor of the plaintiffs and award punitive damages .

text: Striking yet another blow at the very heart of piracy in the Gulf of Aden , Indian warship INS Mysore and its marine commandos thwarted a hijack attempt on an Ethiopian merchant vessel on Saturday and captured 23 pirates and a large arms cache in the operation .
marked_sentence: Striking yet another blow at the very heart of piracy in the Gulf of Aden , Indian warship INS Mysore and its marine commandos thwarted a hijack attempt on an Ethiopian merchant vessel on Saturday and captured 23 pirates and a large arms cache in the <mark id="mark_id"> operation </mark> .
marked_doc: Striking yet another blow at the very heart of piracy in the Gulf of Aden , Indian warship INS Mysore and its marine commandos thwarted a hijack attempt on an Ethiopian merchant vessel on Saturday and captured 23 pirates and a large arms cache in the <mark id="mark_id"> operation </mark> . <p/>The arrest of the 23 pirates ( 12 Somali and 11 Yemeni ) and the arms haul is the largest such seizure in the ongoing anti-piracy operations off Somalia . <p/>The confiscated arms and equipment included seven AK-47s , three other assault rifles , 13 loaded magazines , a rocket-propelled grenade launcher with two rockets , several grenades , a GPS set and a mobile phone . <p/>Early November , the British Royal Navy had captured eight pirates , who were subsequently handed over to Kenya to face trial in the port town of Mombasa . <p/>`` The external affairs ministry is now working to find out to which country the 23 pirates in INS Mysore 's custody can be handed over , '' said a senior officer . <p/>`` INS Mysore , which replaced stealth frigate INS Tabar early December , may head for Djibouti on the horn of Africa . <p/>Our plan to base a maritime reconnaissance aircraft like a Dornier at Djibouti ( which has a French military base ) is also underway , '' he added . <p/>Pirates operating with sheer impunity from ports like Eyl and Hobyo in Somalia , torn apart by an 18-year-old civil war , have already attacked as many as 100 merchant vessels transiting through the crucial shipping lane this year . <p/>At least 17 of the hijacked ships and their crew are still being held captive by the pirates for ransom . <p/>The dramatic action on the high seas on Saturday began at 11am IST when the 6,900-tonne Delhi-class missile destroyer INS Mysore received a `` distress call '' over the MMB Channel 16 from Ethiopian merchant vessel Gibe that it was being attacked by a pirate `` mother dhow '' and a speedboat around 150 nautical miles east of Aden . <p/>An armed Chetak helicopter , with four marine commandos , was immediately `` launched '' from INS Mysore towards Gibe , which was 13 nautical miles from the Indian warship at that point in time . <p/>`` The sailors on Gibe were exchanging small arms fire with the pirates . <p/>On spotting the armed Chetak hovering overhead , the pirate boats broke off their attack , '' said an officer . <p/>Soon after , steaming at full speed , the deadly INS Mysore also reached the spot . <p/>By then , all 23 pirates had clambered onto the 10-metre-long dhow -- later identified as `Salahaddin ' -- in a bid to escape . <p/>INS Mysore then opened fire across the dhow 's bows with its heavy-calibre machine guns , forcing the sea bandits to come to a complete halt . <p/>A detachment of heavily-armed marine commandos promptly sped across to the pirate dhow in their fibre-glass inflatable boats . <p/>`` Seeing the Marcos , the pirates surrendered quite easily , even though for some time they pretended to be plain fishermen . <p/>A search of the dhow led to the discovery of the large arms cache and three outboard motors , '' he said . <p/>`` The grenades , being unstable , were thrown off overboard . <p/>The 23 pirates and the other arms were taken on board INS Mysore , which will resume its patrolling duties after handing over them over to appropriate ashore authorities , '' he added . <p/>Though over 20 warships from US , EU and other countries are patrolling the piracy-infested Gulf of Aden , which connects the Red Sea to the Indian Ocean , it 's actually the Indian Navy which has taken the battle to the pirates . <p/>On November 11 , INS Tabar had repulsed two hijack attempts , one on an Indian ship ( MV Jag Arnav ) and the other on a Saudi oil carrier ( NCC Tihama ) , one after the other . <p/>Then , on November 18 , it had sunk Thai trawler `` Ekawat Nava 5 '' , which had been commandeered by pirates , after a gunbattle . <p/>Though the Navy had come in for some criticism for sinking the Thai trawler , Admiral Sureesh Mehta had declared that his force had done nothing wrong . <p/>`` Thai ownership does not change the situation . <p/>It was under the command of pirates . <p/>Use of force was inevitable ... <p/>We acted in self-defence , '' said the Navy chief . <p/>External affairs minister Pranab Mukherjee , too , had strongly defended the Navy 's anti-piracy action on the high seas .

text: Even as Oscar organizers on Friday unveiled Hugh Jackman as the host of their gala film awards , the prospect of a U.S. actors strike was casting a long shadow over whether Hollywood 's big show would go on as usual .
marked_sentence: Even as <mark id="mark_id"> Oscar </mark> organizers on Friday unveiled Hugh Jackman as the host of their gala film awards , the prospect of a U.S. actors strike was casting a long shadow over whether Hollywood 's big show would go on as usual .
marked_doc: Even as <mark id="mark_id"> Oscar </mark> organizers on Friday unveiled Hugh Jackman as the host of their gala film awards , the prospect of a U.S. actors strike was casting a long shadow over whether Hollywood 's big show would go on as usual . <p/>The Academy Awards ' February 22 date puts it directly in the path of a potential walkout by Screen Actors Guild members who vote next month on whether to give union leaders permission to call a strike in stalemated contract talks with major studios . <p/>Movie making by the big studios has wound down since late June in anticipation of labor strife , compounding a general slowdown from the U.S. recession . <p/>The tension has only been heightened by fatigue from a tumultuous 14-week Hollywood writers strike that ended in February and cost the Los Angeles area economy around $ 3 billion as production stopped on most prime-time TV shows . <p/>`` A strike , if one occurred , would be nothing short of horrible , '' said Ron Howard , the former actor and Oscar-winning director of `` A Beautiful Mind '' whose latest film , `` Frost/Nixon , '' is considered a strong Oscar contender . <p/>`` The timing could n't be worse , '' he said on Thursday . <p/>Actor Leonardo DiCaprio , who on Thursday earned a Golden Globe nomination for his work in `` Revolutionary Road , '' said strike concerns are hitting `` everyone . '' <p/>`` It 's really important that we come up with a solution , '' he said . <p/>`` These are unheard-of times , and no one can predict what is going to happen '' with the U.S. economy . <p/>SAG 'S DARK CLOUD <p/>The Oscars , given out by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences , are annually Hollywood 's glitziest night . <p/>Putting the show in jeopardy , however , was this week 's announcement by SAG that strike authorization ballots will be mailed to its 120,000 members on January 2 and tallied on January 23 , a full month before the Oscars . <p/>That sequence of events raises the prospect of A-list stars boycotting the honors to avoid crossing their own union 's picket lines -- or even carrying picket signs themselves . <p/>The same dynamic came into play last January when a work stoppage by 10,500 Writers Guild of America members threw the awards season into disarray and caused the star-filled Golden Globe Awards to be replaced by a news conference . <p/>Only 5.8 million TV viewers tuned-in , far below the Globes ' typical 20 million audience . <p/>Broadcaster NBC lost an estimated $ 10 million to $ 15 million in advertising revenue . <p/>The writers strike was settled a month later , sparing the Academy Awards and its network , ABC , a similar fate . <p/>But this time around , the Oscars are on the firing line and Australian actor Jackman , star of the `` X-Men '' movies as well as Broadway stage shows , may himself have to pull out . <p/>`` At this point , we are moving forward with all of our plans to do our show , and of course we are monitoring what is going on , '' said Academy spokeswoman Leslie Unger . <p/>SAG leaders say they need a credible strike threat to wrest a better contract deal from the studios than the `` final '' offer management presented before talks collapsed on June 30 . <p/>They stress , however , that a `` yes '' vote does not automatically put a strike into effect , and it remains uncertain whether SAG can muster the support it needs -- 75 percent of those voting -- to pass its authorization . <p/>Talks collapsed over issues that included how much actors would get paid for work on the Internet , and the financial impact of a possible strike on Hollywood remains unclear . <p/>Most films slated for release in 2009 already have been shot , meaning the 2010 slate would see the brunt of a strike . <p/>Some TV prime-time dramas and sitcoms will have completed production before SAG a work stoppage , though a walkout could hinder development of new series for Fall 2009 .

text: The man police say is behind a fatal hit and run outside a Sam 's Club store in Bloomington , now faces a murder charge .
marked_sentence: The man police say is behind a fatal hit and run outside a Sam 's Club store in Bloomington , now <mark id="mark_id"> faces </mark> a murder charge .
marked_doc: Man charged in fatal Bloomington hit and run <p/>The man police say is behind a fatal hit and run outside a Sam 's Club store in Bloomington , now <mark id="mark_id"> faces </mark> a murder charge . <p/>The Hennepin County attorney 's office handed down charges to Anthony Phillip Lasalle Friday , which include one count of third-degree murder and three counts of criminal vehicular homicide . <p/>Police said 66-year-old LuAnn Marie Johnson , of Burnsville , was with her husband when she was struck in the crosswalk outside the store , located at 200 West American Boulevard , around 7 p.m. Wednesday . <p/>Paramedics rushed Johnson to Hennepin County Medical Center where she died . <p/>`` Kind , gentle , Christian , loved the Lord , and she 's better off where she is now , '' said Lois Scholz , a friend of LuAnn 's . <p/>Scholz lives across the hall from LuAnn and her husband Leroy . <p/>`` Leroy was blessed and he 's comfortable with this , '' Scholz said . <p/>`` I talked with him and he 's very at peace with the idea that she 's with the Lord . '' <p/>After a struggle , officers were able to apprehend the Bloomington man a few blocks away from the scene , by using a taser . <p/>During his flee , Lasalle struck two other vehicles , but no one was injured , according to authorities . <p/>According to the criminal complaint , Lasalle was transported to Fairview Southdale Hospital to be treated for his injures he sustained during his apprehension . <p/>He also had blood drawn , which was tested , and resulted in showing his blood-alcohol level was .41 . <p/>Lasalle told police he had drank a half-liter of vodka before driving to Sam 's Club . <p/>He also admitted that he knew he had hit someone and was required to stop . <p/>However , he told officials that because he was drunk , it affected his decision to leave the scene . <p/>State records show Lasalle has three prior DUI convictions , spanning from 1990 to 1991 . <p/>He also has two motor vehicle theft convictions . <p/>Lasalle is in custody . <p/>If convicted , he faces up to 55 years in prison , a $ 60,000 fine , or both .

text: On July 13 , Obama announced that he was nominating Regina M . Benjamin , MD , a family physician from southern Alabama , to be surgeon general .
marked_sentence: On July 13 , Obama <mark id="mark_id"> announced </mark> that he was nominating Regina M . Benjamin , MD , a family physician from southern Alabama , to be surgeon general .
marked_doc: http : / / www . amednews . com / article / 20090720 / government / 307209986 / 1 / <p/>Former AMA trustee Dr . Benjamin nominated to be surgeon general <p/>Posted July 20 , 2009 <p/>President Obama's choices to be the nation's top physician and top scientist are both hands - on practitioners with extensive leadership experience . <p/>On July 13 , Obama <mark id="mark_id"> announced </mark> that he was nominating Regina M . Benjamin , MD , a family physician from southern Alabama , to be surgeon general . <p/>Dr . Benjamin , 52 , became the first woman and first African - American president of the Medical Assn . of the State of Alabama in 2002 . <p/>She also completed a term in June as chair of the AMA Council on Ethical and Judicial Affairs and served on the AMA Board of Trustees from 1995 to 1998 , becoming the first physician under 40 to serve on the board in a non - resident role . <p/>On July 8 , Obama nominated Francis S . Collins , MD , PhD , as director of the National Institutes of Health . <p/>Dr . Collins , 59 , led the Human Genome Project - - an effort to sequence and map human genes , that concluded in 2003 . <p/>He left his position as director of the NIH's National Human Genome Research Institute in 2008 after 15 years but maintains a lab at the NIH's Bethesda , Md . , campus . <p/>Both nominees must first be confirmed by the Senate . <p/>AMA President J . James Rohack , MD , said Dr . Benjamin has an impressive list of accomplishments , including receiving a MacArthur Fellowship in 2008 , commonly known as the "genius grant . " <p/>But awards are not her main focus , he said . <p/>"Dr . Benjamin's most important qualification for surgeon general is her deep commitment to her patients . " <p/>Dr . Benjamin said in the White House Rose Garden announcement that the deaths of close relatives from preventable diseases drove her to focus on public health . <p/>"My father died with diabetes and hypertension . <p/>My older brother , and only sibling , died at age 44 of HIV - related illness . <p/>My mother died of lung cancer , because as a young girl , she wanted to smoke just like her twin brother could . " <p/>Dr . Collins' colleagues said he is a natural choice to head the primary federal agency for funding and conducting medical research because of his thoughtfulness , willingness to listen and experience as a spokesman for the genome mapping effort . <p/>"He's a forceful personality , " said Tom Murray , PhD , head of the Hastings Center , an independent bioethics research institute . <p/>"He wants to hear from people who don't agree with him . " <p/>Patients before profits <p/>If confirmed , Dr . Benjamin would be the nation's lead public health educator . <p/>Fellow physicians see the role as a good fit . <p/>Besides experience with family illnesses , Dr . Benjamin said she also was influenced by her medical school training under David Satcher , MD , PhD , who later became surgeon general , and others who focused on public health issues in underserved areas . <p/>Jorge Alsip , MD , the Alabama medical society's president , said Dr . Benjamin has seen how much patients in poor and rural areas appreciate her help . <p/>"That can't help but affect you and make you want to do something for these people , " said Dr . Alsip , an emergency physician who has known Dr . Benjamin for more than 15 years . <p/>Dr . Alsip also said Dr . Benjamin is tenacious . <p/>"If Regina's in a fight , don't ever bet against her . " <p/>She rebuilt her clinic in Bayou La Batre , Ala . , twice after hurricanes destroyed it and is rebuilding it a third time after a fire . <p/>Obama said his surgeon general pick has personally witnessed how the U . S . health system is broken . <p/>"She's seen an increasing number of patients who've had health insurance their entire lives suddenly lose it because they lost their jobs or because it's simply become too expensive . " <p/>Dr . Benjamin lamented the difficulty some doctors face in caring for patients , regardless of ability to pay . <p/>"It shouldn't be this expensive for Americans to get health care in this country , " she said . <p/>Obama said Dr . Benjamin has forgone a salary when her clinic faced financial hardship . <p/>Jeff Terry , MD , chair of the AMA's Alabama delegation and a urologist , said Dr . Benjamin has proven herself through work in organized medicine and elsewhere . <p/>The two co - founded the young physicians section of the state medical society nearly two decades ago . <p/>Since then , she has held leadership positions in physician organizations and other groups . <p/>Dr . Benjamin is also probably more politically liberal than many physicians on Alabama's Gulf Coast , Dr . Terry said . <p/>"Maybe President Obama saw a little of that in her . " <p/>Both scientific and religious <p/>Obama lauded Dr . Collins' experience in the July 8 announcement . <p/>"Dr . Collins is one of the top scientists in the world , and his groundbreaking work has changed the very ways we consider our health and examine disease . " <p/>Dr . Collins' laboratory discovered several important genes , including those responsible for cystic fibrosis and Huntington's disease . <p/>Acquaintances and colleagues predicted that Dr . Collins would do a good job representing NIH in front of lawmakers and others . <p/>He is a very approachable person who doesn't rely on jargon to communicate , said Sean B . Tipton , spokesman for the American Society of Reproductive Medicine . <p/>"He has an ability to interact with the public and with policymakers and the press that I think will serve him very well as an NIH director . " <p/>The Hastings Center's Murray said that if Dr . Collins ever made a mistake , it may be that he was a bit overly enthusiastic when describing the potential for breakthroughs when he was leading the Human Genome Project . <p/>Still , "I can't fault the scientist who really believes in their work for being enthusiastic as they talk to Congress , " Murray said . <p/>Dr . Collins has garnered attention by professing that his belief in God can coexist with his pursuit of science . <p/>He's written books on the topic , including the 2007 best - seller The Language of God : A Scientist Presents Evidence for Belief . <p/>He is also founder and president of the BioLogos Foundation , whose purpose is to find compatibility between the scientific and religious searches for truth . <p/>In an interview with the spiritual Web site Beliefnet in 2007 , Dr . Collins said Christians who reject scientific evolutionary theory are also rejecting humans' ability to understand , a God - given skill . <p/>But there are limits to the questions science can answer , such as why we are here or what happens after death , he said . <p/>William Hurlbut , MD , a consulting professor of neuroscience at Stanford University and a former member of President George W . Bush's Council on Bioethics , said the idea that science and religion can't coexist is ridiculous . <p/>"A person with Francis' background is a very wise choice" for NIH chief , he said .

text: An arrest for suspicion of driving under the influence will not affect the playing status of San Diego Chargers wide receiver Vincent Jackson for Sunday 's divisional playoff game at Pittsburgh .
marked_sentence: An arrest for suspicion of driving under the influence will not affect the <mark id="mark_id"> playing </mark> status of San Diego Chargers wide receiver Vincent Jackson for Sunday 's divisional playoff game at Pittsburgh .
marked_doc: Chargers WR Jackson will play vs. Steelers <p/>An arrest for suspicion of driving under the influence will not affect the <mark id="mark_id"> playing </mark> status of San Diego Chargers wide receiver Vincent Jackson for Sunday 's divisional playoff game at Pittsburgh . <p/>Jackson was arrested on the DUI charge early Tuesday morning by the California Highway Patrol . <p/>However , the fourth-year wide receiver likely will not face disciplinary action until the 2009 season . <p/>An NFL spokesman on Wednesday said the league will await a determination by the court before considering disciplinary action against Jackson . <p/>Along with the misdemeanor DUI allegation , California Highway Patrol Officer Brad Baehr said Jackson was cited for driving on probation for a prior DUI . <p/>Jackson issued a statement released through the team . <p/>`` I was stopped by an officer , '' he said . <p/>`` I do n't think any charges will be filed as a result of the stop . <p/>In the event they are , I look forward to clearing my name and proving my innocence . '' <p/>Baehr said he was not aware of the particulars of the previous DUI charge and that results of Jackson 's blood test are pending . <p/>Jackson had his finest season in 2008 with with 59 receptions for 1,098 yards and seven touchdowns for the AFC West champions . <p/>`` We 're aware of the off-the-field issue involving Vincent , '' team general manager A.J. Smith said in a statement . <p/>`` Obviously we 're disappointed . <p/>We take these issues very seriously . <p/>Moving forward , we will monitor the situation and have no further comment . ''

text: A just- fired employee of a Canadian health products company crashed the office Christmas party in Vancouver , killing the chief executive officer , police said .
marked_sentence: A just- fired employee of a Canadian health products company crashed the office Christmas party in Vancouver , <mark id="mark_id"> killing </mark> the chief executive officer , police said .
marked_doc: A just- fired employee of a Canadian health products company crashed the office Christmas party in Vancouver , <mark id="mark_id"> killing </mark> the chief executive officer , police said . <p/>Vancouver police identified the victim of the Friday night shooting at the TallGrass Distributors Ltd . <p/>Christmas party as Benjamin Banky , 40 , the Canadian Broadcasting Corp. reported . <p/>Police said Eric Allen Kirkpatrick , 61 , surrendered after two hours of negotiations with police and was charged Saturday with first-degree murder , the CBC reported . <p/>Kirkpatrick had been dismissed from his job Thursday . <p/>Authorities said they did not know how long he had worked at TallGrass or the reasons for his termination . <p/>Other employees of TallGrass Distributors Ltd. escaped unharmed , The Vancouver Sun reported . <p/>`` A man who apparently had just been let go from his job there came in , shot and killed another man , '' Police Constable Tim Fanning said . <p/>`` Our negotiators got on the phone with him right away , and fortunately were able to talk him down from his very , very excited and upset state . '' <p/>Police blocked the street in the Mount Pleasant neighborhood . <p/>Employees of other companies in the area were asked to stay where they were until the surrendered . <p/>TallGrass distributes products based on hemp , including Body Dope , a brand of skincare products .

text: President Nominates Regina Benjamin , MD to Serve as Surgeon General
marked_sentence: President Nominates Regina Benjamin , MD to <mark id="mark_id"> Serve </mark> as Surgeon General
marked_doc: http : / / www . nlm . nih . gov / news / benjamin _ surg _ gen . html <p/>President Nominates Regina Benjamin , MD to <mark id="mark_id"> Serve </mark> as Surgeon General <p/>Rural Family Physician Featured in NLM's "Changing the Face of Medicine" Exhibition <p/>President Obama has nominated Alabama physician Dr . Regina Benjamin to be US Surgeon General . <p/>Dr . Benjamin is one of the outstanding American women physicians profiled in NLM's 2003 - 2005 exhibition , "Changing the Face of Medicine . " <p/>Her biography appears at : http : / / www . nlm . nih . gov / changingthefaceofmedicine / physicians / biography _ 31 . html . <p/>With support from the American Library Association , "Changing the Face of Medicine" is traveling the nation through November 2010 . <p/>You can view the itinerary at : http : / / www . nlm . nih . gov / hmd / about / exhibition / travelingexhibitions / ctfom . html . <p/>Dr . Benjamin , who has held leadership positions statewide and nationally , has long provided medical care on the Gulf Coast . <p/>In 1990 , she founded Bayou La Batre Rural Health Clinic in the fishing village of Bayou La Batre , Alabama . <p/>Her clinic was battered by Hurricane Georges in 1998 and Hurricane Katrina in 2005 , but Benjamin rebuilt it each time and continued to offer medical care to the village's 2 , 500 residents . <p/>Many of her family practice patients are uninsured , according to the MacArthur Foundation , which last year awarded her one of its prestigious $500 , 000 "genius" grants . <p/>Her patient population includes immigrants from Vietnam , Cambodia and Laos , who comprise a third of Bayou La Batre's population . <p/>Benjamin received a bachelor's degree in 1979 from Xavier University of Louisiana , attended Morehouse School of Medicine from 1980 to 1982 and received a doctor of medicine degree from the University of Alabama at Birmingham in 1984 . <p/>She completed her residency in family practice at the Medical Center of Central Georgia in 1987 and has served as CEO of the Bayou La Batre Rural Health Clinic since its founding in 1990 . <p/>She earned a master's degree in business administration in 1991 from Tulane University . <p/>Dr . Benjamin also served as the associate dean for rural health at the University of South Alabama's College of Medicine and as president of the State of Alabama Medical Association from 2002 to 2003 . <p/>She is the first woman , first African American woman and first person under age 40 to sit on the board of trustees of the American Medical Association , serving from 1995 through 1998 . <p/>The U . S . Surgeon General serves as America's chief health educator by providing Americans the best scientific information available on how to improve their health and reduce the risk of illness and injury . <p/>In carrying out all responsibilities , the Surgeon General reports to the Assistant Secretary for Health , who is the principal advisor to the Secretary of Health and Human Services on public health and scientific issues . <p/>The US Surgeon General also serves on the NLM Board of Regents as an ex officio member .

text: Now that it 's been confirmed that Hugh Jackman will be hosting the 81st Annual Academy Awards , instantly upping the annual ceremony 's overall attractiveness , the Ampersand would like to offer some heartfelt advice to the first-time Oscar host .
marked_sentence: Now that it 's been confirmed that Hugh Jackman will be hosting the 81st Annual <mark id="mark_id"> Academy Awards </mark> , instantly upping the annual ceremony 's overall attractiveness , the Ampersand would like to offer some heartfelt advice to the first-time Oscar host .
marked_doc: Now that it 's been confirmed that Hugh Jackman will be hosting the 81st Annual <mark id="mark_id"> Academy Awards </mark> , instantly upping the annual ceremony 's overall attractiveness , the Ampersand would like to offer some heartfelt advice to the first-time Oscar host . <p/>True , Jackman held his own just fine as the host of both the 2004 and 2005 Tony Awards , earning an Emmy for the former , but this is a whole new ballgame . <p/>So without further ado , Hugh , a list of dos and don'ts when hosting the Academy Awards: <p/>DO Keep jokes tight , snappy and to-the-point , a la Jon Stewart . <p/>Stewart pulled off a television miracle last year when he hosted the 2007 Oscars only 11 days after the WGA writer 's strike ended , meaning that his jokes and opening speech were last-minute writes . <p/>This did n't seem to dampen Stewart 's usual comedic flair . <p/>Keeping a constant string of quick ( and often political ) one-liners coming at the audience , who had to keep on their toes so as not to miss anything , he made sure that the ceremonies did n't get bogged down , keeping things lively . <p/>My personal favourite quip: <p/>`` Oscar is 80 this year , which makes him now automatically the front-runner for the Republican nomination . '' <p/>A `` John McCain is so old '' joke is never in bad taste ! <p/>Stewart also oozed confidence , despite lackluster reviews of his hosting job in 2006 . <p/>DO Channel Johnny Carson . <p/>Carson is considered the epitome of the Oscar host . <p/>He hosted the ceremony five times and found that magical place where a joke is just biting enough , but does n't sting . <p/>`` I see some new faces here , especially on the old ones , '' he joked in one opening speech . <p/>See ? <p/>Slightly scathing , but playful . <p/>After all , the last thing you want to do is piss off your entire industry . <p/>DO Allow yourself to get star-struck . <p/>Even the Hollywood heavy-weights that host the Oscars are allowed to be overwhelmed by the folks the statuettes are being presented to . <p/>While obviously a part of her act , there was something very endearing about Ellen DeGeneres pausing in her host spiel to snap a Myspace picture of her and Clint Eastwood and letting the audience know what a thrill the experience of hosting for them was . <p/>Nothing 's going to get the audience on your side like admitting they they impress you . <p/>DO Go Big . <p/>Hollywood has never been about self-restraint or simplicity . <p/>When celebrating the movie industry you 've got to be lavish . <p/>While Jackman has a certain composed air about him and oozes class ( have you seen a picture of him in a tux ? ) he could benefit from a spectacular entrance like Whoopi Goldberg 's in 1999 ( she waltzed on stage in full Queen Elizabeth get-up ) . <p/>It 's Hollywood : go big , baby . <p/>DO Watch the time <p/>Since the introduction of the play-off music that cuts award recipients off when they get too long-winded ( is there anything more embarrassing than watching an A-lister chase the microphone as its lowered into the stage in order to get that last thank-you in ? ) , the Oscars have been trimmer in recent years . <p/>But just as dangerous as the ceremony going over is it running short . <p/>It happened in 1959 . <p/>Then host Jerry Lewis forced that year 's winners to dance awkwardly around the stage in order to fill the last twenty minutes of his broadcast . <p/>Mortifying . <p/>Avoid at all costs . <p/>DO N'T Appropriate . <p/>It will always be funny when Billy Crystal relives the year 's greatest films ( or rather , dodges certain death within them ) in an intricate opening montage . <p/>He 's done it eight times already and it has yet to get old . <p/>That being said , it 's Crystal 's thing . <p/>Jackman will have to come up with his own trademark hosting quirk . <p/>Might I suggest flashy , high-kicking song and dance numbers ? <p/>DO N'T Do anything that David Letterman did . <p/>Enough said . <p/>DO N'T Be afraid to be abusive or controversial . <p/>While no one ever wants to see a repeat of Michael Moore 's rant in 2001 , it 's the snippy , daring jokes and comments that are remembered , like Steve Martin 's improvistation right after the aforementioned tirade .

text: San Diego Chargers wide receiver Vincent Jackson was arrested on suspicion of driving under the influence early Tuesday morning .
marked_sentence: San Diego Chargers wide receiver Vincent Jackson was arrested on <mark id="mark_id"> suspicion </mark> of driving under the influence early Tuesday morning .
marked_doc: Chargers ' Jackson arrested on suspicion of DUI <p/>San Diego Chargers wide receiver Vincent Jackson was arrested on <mark id="mark_id"> suspicion </mark> of driving under the influence early Tuesday morning . <p/>According to the San Diego Union-Tribune , Jackson was pulled over on state Route 52 just past 2:30 a.m. in the Clairemont section of San Diego , following an observed traffic violation . <p/>He was booked and later released . <p/>Jackson could be facing misdemeanors on the alleged DUI itself in addition to violating probation for a prior DUI charge . <p/>Jackson released a statement through the team later Tuesday . <p/>`` Yesterday I was stopped by an officer . <p/>I do n't think any charges will be filed as a result of the stop . <p/>In the event they are , I look forward to clearing my name and proving my innocence . '' <p/>A fourth-year pro out of Northern Colorado , Jackson enjoyed a breakout year for the Chargers this season . <p/>He set career-highs of 59 receptions , 1,098 yards and seven touchdowns . <p/>San Diego knocked off the Indianapolis Colts , 23-17 , in last Saturday 's AFC Wild Card matchup after posting a 52-21 thumping over division rival Denver in a regular season finale that decided the AFC West champion . <p/>The Chargers are getting set to take on the Pittsburgh Steelers Sunday in an AFC Divisional playoff tilt .

text: Vancouver police have arrested a 61-year-old former employee after the shooting at Tallgrass Distributors Ltd. , an organic supplements and health product store in the Mount Pleasant neighbourhood near downtown Vancouver .

marked_doc: One man is dead after being shot by a gunman who marched into a company Christmas party Friday night . <p/>Vancouver police have arrested a 61-year-old former employee after the <mark id="mark_id"> shooting </mark> at Tallgrass Distributors Ltd. , an organic supplements and health product store in the Mount Pleasant neighbourhood near downtown Vancouver . <p/>`` A man who apparently had just been let go from his job there came in , shot and killed another man , '' Vancouver police Const . <p/>Tim Fanning told a news conference . <p/>`` There was at least a dozen other people on the scene . <p/>They managed to get out . <p/>`` Our negotiators got on the phone with him right away , and fortunately were able to talk him down from his very , very excited and upset state . text: The Indian navy captured 23 pirates who threatened a merchant vessel in the lawless waters of the Gulf of Aden and a German naval helicopter thwarted another attack Saturday on a freighter being chased by speedboats off Yemen .
marked_sentence: The Indian navy captured 23 pirates who threatened a merchant vessel in the <mark id="mark_id"> lawless </mark> waters of the Gulf of Aden and a German naval helicopter thwarted another attack Saturday on a freighter being chased by speedboats off Yemen .
marked_doc: The Indian navy captured 23 pirates who threatened a merchant vessel in the <mark id="mark_id"> lawless </mark> waters of the Gulf of Aden and a German naval helicopter thwarted another attack Saturday on a freighter being chased by speedboats off Yemen . <p/>The successes came days before Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice was to ask the United Nations to authorize `` all necessary measures '' against increasingly bold Somalian pirates operating in one of the world 's busiest shipping lanes . <p/>An Indian navy ship , the INS Mysore , was escorting merchant ships in waters off Somalia 's coast Saturday when it received a distress call from seamen on board the MV Gibe , who said they were being fired on by two boats that were approaching fast . <p/>The Mysore and its helicopter sped to the scene , and the pirate boats attempted to escape when they saw them , according to a statement from the Indian government . <p/>Indian marine commandoes boarded the pirate boats and seized `` a substantial cache of arms and equipment , '' including seven AK-47 assault rifles , three machine guns , a rocket-propelled grenade launcher and other weapons , the statement said . <p/>They also found a GPS receiver and other equipment . <p/>The pirates were from Somalia and Yemen , two countries on the coast of the Gulf of Aden . <p/>The Gibe was flying an Ethiopian flag but little else was known about it , the Indian statement said . <p/>Last month , India 's navy drew criticism after sinking a Thai fishing trawler that had been commandeered hours earlier by pirates . <p/>At least one Thai crew member was killed in the attack , which the Indian navy had originally announced by saying it had sunk a pirate `` mother ship . '' <p/>The Indian navy defended its actions , saying it had fired in self-defense . <p/>Somali pirates have become increasingly brazen and recently seized a Saudi supertanker loaded with $ 100 million of crude oil . <p/>Many of the vessels are taken to pirate-controlled regions in Somalia , where they are held for ransom . <p/>It was not immediately clear what would happen to the pirates captured by the Indians , or where they would be taken . <p/>The statement said only that the prisoners and their weapons would be `` handed over to appropriate authorities ashore . '' <p/>Most foreign navies patrolling the Somali coast have been reluctant to detain suspects because of uncertainties over where they would face trial , since Somalia has no effective central government or legal system . <p/>Also on Saturday , a German military spokesman said a navy frigate had chased away pirates in speedboats pursuing an Ethiopian freighter off the coast of Yemen . <p/>The German frigate responded to a distress call from the freighter , and a helicopter took off from the deck to investigate . <p/>The pirates turned away from the freighter as the helicopter flew overhead , said the spokesman , who declined to give his name in line with military policy . <p/>An estimated 1,500 pirates are based in Somalia 's semiautonomous Puntland region , raking in millions of dollars . <p/>Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice will present a draft Security Council resolution next week asking the United Nations to authorize `` all necessary measures '' against piracy from Somalia . <p/>However , the commander of the U.S. Navy 's 5th Fleet expressed doubt Friday about the wisdom of launching attacks against Somali pirates on land , as the draft proposes . <p/>U.S. Vice Adm. Bill Gortney told reporters that it is difficult to identify pirates , and the potential for killing innocent civilians `` can not be overestimated . '' <p/>The threat of pirates recently prompted a German cruise ship to evacuate some 420 passengers and crew after the company decided not to risk their safety as the ship passed through the Gulf of Aden . <p/>The passengers and crew have rejoined the M/S Columbus - which is on a six-month round-the-world trip - in Oman 's port of Salalah after three days in Dubai , Hamburg-based cruise operator Hapag-Lloyd said Saturday . <p/>The ship and a limited crew made it through the gulf without incident , a company spokeswoman said .

text: 1 dead , 2 hurt in Mich . office shooting ; police say suspect had worked there
marked_sentence: 1 <mark id="mark_id"> dead </mark> , 2 hurt in Mich . office shooting ; police say suspect had worked there
marked_doc: http : / / usatoday30 . usatoday . com / news / nation / 2007 - 04 - 09 - office - shooting _ N . htm <p/>1 <mark id="mark_id"> dead </mark> , 2 hurt in Mich . office shooting ; police say suspect had worked there <p/>Updated 4 / 9 / 2007 6 : 04 PM <p/>A man suspected of shooting three people at an accounting firm where he had worked was arrested a few hours later after a high - speed chase , authorities said . <p/>One victim died in the Monday morning attack . <p/>Police said they had located Anthony LaCalamita , 38 , of Troy on Interstate 75 , north of the suburban Detroit office building where the shootings took place . <p/>ON DEADLINE : Live updates and local coverage <p/>Sheriff's deputies and state police chased him at speeds of more than 100 mph before he finally pulled over after about 15 minutes , Genesee County Undersheriff James Gage said . <p/>"He probably realized if he didn't , he was going to be shot , " Gage said . <p/>He said LaCalamita was being brought to Genesee County , since it was the arresting agency . <p/>Officers found a gun in the vehicle matching the description of the one used in the shootings , Troy police Lt . Gerry Scherlinck said . <p/>Some witnesses told police that when the shooter walked into the office on the building's second floor around 10 a . m . Monday , he looked as if he was trying to hide something , Troy Police Chief Charles Craft said . <p/>Police couldn't say how many shots were fired . <p/>"I'm not positive all three of the people were targeted , but there appeared to be some purpose , " Craft said . <p/>The families of the two wounded men requested "total privacy , " and the hospital would not release any details about their conditions , Beaumont Hospital spokeswoman Ilene Wolfe said . <p/>She said the third victim died on the way to the hospital . <p/>LaCalamita was listed among the professional staff on the website of Gordon Advisors , a public accounting and business consulting firm in the building . <p/>Calls to Gordon Advisors were not answered Monday afternoon , and a recording said the offices were closed . <p/>Scherlinck described the shooter as a former employee of one of the offices who might have been terminated as recently as a week ago . <p/>The man was armed with a long gun , either a shotgun or a rifle , Scherlinck said . <p/>The 170 , 000 - square - foot building houses a number of businesses , including law offices and the accounting firm where the shooting was believed to have occurred . <p/>Police at first told workers to stay in their offices but a short time later evacuated the building , about 15 miles north of Detroit . <p/>Bill Adgate , who works at LPL Financial inside the building , said he had hunkered down inside the office for a couple of hours with furniture pushed up against the door . <p/>He said police told the group to stay put until officers allowed them to leave . <p/>"It's tough . <p/>I want to get out , " Adgate said by telephone .

text: Fired Accountant Goes on Shooting Spree
marked_sentence: Fired Accountant Goes on Shooting <mark id="mark_id"> Spree </mark>
marked_doc: http : / / www . accountingweb . com / topic / watchdog / fired - accountant - goes - shooting - spree <p/>Fired Accountant Goes on Shooting <mark id="mark_id"> Spree </mark> <p/>on Apr 12 2007 <p/>A fired accountant bought a shotgun the day after he lost his job , then returned to the office the following week and opened fire on his bosses , wounding both and killing a receptionist , the Associated Press reported . <p/>Troy , Mich . police said Anthony LaCalamita III , 38 , targeted two managers and also may have intended to shoot another one . <p/>"There is a suspicion that there might have been a third upper management official he was seeking , " said Troy police Lt . Gerry Scherlinck . <p/>The man , whom police did not identify , was not in the office at the time of the attack . <p/>LaCalamita had been fired last Thursday as a general accountant at the firm and bought a shotgun and shells on Friday , Scherlinck said . <p/>He said police found a box consistent with one that would hold a shotgun , as well as empty shell boxes , in a Dumpster outside LaCalamita's apartment Monday evening . <p/>When LaCalamita was arrested , police said they found a 12 - gauge pump - action shotgun and three shells in his vehicle . <p/>Scherlinck said LaCalamita had been denied a handgun permit in March but it wasn't clear why . <p/>Anthony LaCalamita III , 38 , had been arrested following a high - speed chase shortly after the Monday morning shootings at Gordon Advisors in suburban Detroit . <p/>During LaCalamita's arraignment , authorities described what witnesses saw inside the accounting firm's offices that morning . <p/>LaCalamita walked in around 10 a . m . , stopped briefly at the reception desk , then entered Alan Steinberg's office with the shotgun , Troy police Sgt . Barry Whiteside testified . <p/>Steinberg , a partner in the firm , later told police LaCalamita loaded a shell into the shotgun's chamber and fired at him , hitting him in the hip area . <p/>He then walked toward the office of Paul Riva , another partner . <p/>Receptionist Madeline Kafoury was standing in the doorway of Riva's office , and the gunman fatally shot her in the midsection , Whiteside said . <p/>LaCalamita shot Riva in the upper chest , then left the building , Whiteside said . <p/>He was gone when officers swarmed the office building and began evacuating other workers , then was arrested a few hours later after a chase on a nearby interstate . <p/>Riva had yet to regain consciousness Wednesday and was on a ventilator , police said . <p/>LaCalamita is charged with first - degree murder in the death of Kafoury , 63 , and intent to murder in the shootings of Riva , 47 , and Steinberg , 48 . <p/>He also is charged with possession of a firearm in the commission of a felony and fleeing and eluding police . <p/>A not guilty plea was entered on LaCalamita's behalf during the hearing . <p/>Asked by the judge if he understood the charges against him and if he was aware that he could be sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole if convicted of first - degree murder , he responded "Yes . " <p/>The judge ordered him held without bail pending his next court hearing April 19 . <p/>The judge said he would appoint a lawyer for LaCalamita . <p/>He did not have a representative in court Wednesday . <p/>LaCalamita is married , but his wife , Michele , released a statement saying they had been separated for about three weeks . <p/>According to real estate records obtained by The Associated Press , the couple during the past year actively bought and sold suburban homes . <p/>Records list Michele LaCalamita as the owner of all four . <p/>Riva and Steinberg were being treated at Beaumont Hospital , where spokeswoman Ilene Wolff said the families of the wounded men asked that their conditions and other information not be released .

text: Shooting at Accounting Firm Leaves Woman Dead and 2 Hurt
marked_sentence: Shooting at Accounting Firm Leaves Woman Dead and 2 <mark id="mark_id"> Hurt </mark>
marked_doc: http : / / www . nytimes . com / 2007 / 04 / 10 / us / 10revenge . html ? _ r=0 <p/>Shooting at Accounting Firm Leaves Woman Dead and 2 <mark id="mark_id"> Hurt </mark> <p/>Published : April 10 , 2007 <p/>A man who was fired last week from his job at an accounting firm in suburban Detroit walked into his former office with a shotgun on Monday and shot three people , killing one , before fleeing and leading police officers on a high - speed chase , the authorities said . <p/>The suspect , identified as Anthony LaCalamita , entered the second - floor office of the accounting firm , Gordon Advisors , about 10 a . m . and opened fire , the police said . <p/>A 63 - year - old woman and two men , ages 47 and 48 , were shot , the police said . <p/>The woman , identified by the police as Madeline Kafoury , died at the scene , the authorities said . <p/>The two other victims were being treated at Beaumont Hospital in Royal Oak . <p/>Ilene Wolff , a spokeswoman for the hospital , said that their families had requested privacy , and that the hospital was not releasing any information about their condition or the nature of their injuries . <p/>Though the police declined to release the names of the two men , The Detroit Free Press identified them as Paul Riva , 47 , of Sterling Heights and Alan Steinberg , 48 , of Bruce Township . <p/>Both are partners in the firm , the newspaper reported . <p/>Mr . LaCalamita , 38 , who was still listed on the firm ’ s Web site as a member of its “ professional staff , ” had been dismissed last week , the police said . <p/>Though they would not say what his relationship was with any of the victims or what led to the shootings , “ it doesn ’ t appear it was random , ” the Troy police chief , Charles Craft , said . <p/>Officers and witnesses described a chaotic scene immediately after the shooting as workers barricaded themselves in their cubicles and offices . <p/>A few hours later , some employees gathered outside the building but would not speak to reporters . <p/>The three - story office building houses other tenants in addition to the accounting firm , and appeared to have no formal security system , Chief Craft said . <p/>He said witnesses told the police that Mr . LaCalamita had walked into the building and into the firm ’ s unlocked suite as though he were concealing something . <p/>Mr . LaCalamita fled in his car before officers arrived , but witnesses took note of the license plate number , the authorities said . <p/>About two hours after the shooting , officers received a tip from a motorist in Flint , about 50 miles north of here , on the whereabouts of the car . <p/>Police officers chased Mr . LaCalamita for about 30 miles at speeds of up to 120 miles an hour on Interstate 75 before apprehending him near Bay City .

text: Indian Naval Ship Sukanya , presently deployed on anti - piracy patrols in the Gulf of Aden under the operational control of the Western Naval Command , found herself once again in the thick of things , thwarting a multiple - boat piracy attack on 10 Nov 11 .
marked_sentence: Indian Naval Ship Sukanya , presently deployed on anti - piracy <mark id="mark_id"> patrols </mark> in the Gulf of Aden under the operational control of the Western Naval Command , found herself once again in the thick of things , thwarting a multiple - boat piracy attack on 10 Nov 11 .
marked_doc: http : / / www . freerepublic . com / focus / f - news / 2807784 / posts <p/>Indian Naval Ship Interdicts Three Pirate Vessels In A Single Operation <p/>Posted on November 15 , 2011 6 : 07 : 15 PM GMT+01 : 0 <p/>Indian Naval Ship Sukanya , presently deployed on anti - piracy <mark id="mark_id"> patrols </mark> in the Gulf of Aden under the operational control of the Western Naval Command , found herself once again in the thick of things , thwarting a multiple - boat piracy attack on 10 Nov 11 . <p/>The ship was escorting a group of five merchant vessels through the IRTC ( Internationally Recognised Transit Corridor ) when , at about 9 : 25 in the morning of 10th Nov , she detected a group of five suspicious boats , speedily approaching the merchant vessels of her group . <p/>The warship immediately altered towards the suspicious vessels and challenged them . <p/>On seeing the resolve evident in the warship ’ s action and probably mindful of the reputation for resolute action that the Indian Navy justly enjoys in such deployments , the pirate skiffs reversed course and tried to flee the area . <p/>While two of them managed to get away , the Sukanya successfully intercepted the remaining three and carried out well practiced and professionally executed boarding - and - search action . <p/>The three boats had a total of 26 Somali crew onboard . <p/>During the operation , six AK 47 rifles , 12 Magazines and about 300 rounds of ammunition were found and confiscated . <p/>In addition , the boarding party also found a host of other equipment such as grapnels , ladders and rope - handling gloves all of which confirmed their piratical intent . <p/>The timely operation by Sukanya resulted , once again , in foiling the pirates ’ intention of attacking merchant vessels transiting this busy sea lane through which over a hundred Billion Dollars of India ’ s external trade passes each year . <p/>This is the fifth successful anti - piracy operation conducted by Sukanya , in the course of her ongoing patrol mission in the Gulf of Aden , which commenced in September . <p/>The ship has , thus far , confiscated a total of 14 AK 47 Rifles , 31 Magazines and 923 rounds of ammunition , thereby ensuring that the Indian Navy retains its standing as a force not to be trifled with , and remains at the forefront of anti - piracy operations , as a critical component of the international effort to curb piracy and ensure the safety and freedom of seaborne trade , even in this highly risk - prone area .

text: Obama nominates new surgeon general : MacArthur "genius grant" fellow Regina Benjamin
marked_sentence: Obama <mark id="mark_id"> nominates </mark> new surgeon general : MacArthur "genius grant" fellow Regina Benjamin
marked_doc: http : / / www . scientificamerican . com / blog / post . cfm ? id=obama - nominates - new - surgeon - general - 2009 - 07 - 13 <p/>Obama <mark id="mark_id"> nominates </mark> new surgeon general : MacArthur "genius grant" fellow Regina Benjamin <p/>Jul 13 , 2009 01 : 40 PM <p/>As the country's politicos have their sights set on the U . S . Supreme Court confirmation hearings for Sonia Sotomayor today , President Barack Obama nominated Regina Benjamin , 52 , as the country's new surgeon general , the "leading spokesperson on issues of public health , " Obama said . <p/>Benjamin , a rural family doctor in Alabama , was a 2008 MacArthur Foundation Fellow , and in 1995 she was elected to the American Medical Association's board of trustees , making her both the first black woman on the board and the first AMA trustee to be elected before the age of 40 . <p/>In 1990 she founded the Bayou La Batre Rural Health Clinic , which cares for a largely uninsured working - class community that was hit by both Hurricanes Katrina and George . <p/>In addition to providing for her ill patients - whether or not they can foot the bill - "she's been a relentless promoter of prevention and wellness programs , " Obama said about Benjamin , who has had many relatives have die of preventable diseases . <p/>In her acceptance speech , Benjamin thanked two of her mentors : former Surgeon General David Satcher and former Secretary of Health and Human Services , Louis Sullivan . <p/>If confirmed by the Senate , she will replace Rear Admiral Steven K . Galson , who has been acting surgeon general since October 2007 . <p/>The surgeon general "communicates the best science , evidence , and data to the American people for them to make healthy choices , " according to the Office of the Surgeon General's Web site . <p/>CNN correspondent Sanjay Gupta had been the front - runner for the spot earlier this year until he pulled himself out of consideration .

text: Gupta would n't comment to me -- while not denying the story -- but confirmed on his Twitter feed that he `` has been approached by the Obama administration about the U.S. surgeon general 's post . ''
marked_sentence: Gupta would n't comment to me -- while not <mark id="mark_id"> denying </mark> the story -- but confirmed on his Twitter feed that he `` has been approached by the Obama administration about the U.S. surgeon general 's post . ''
marked_doc: I confirmed yesterday that Obama has offered the job and that Gupta had all but officially accepted . <p/>Got it up on the Web site at 2:36 p.m. , mere moments after filing the story . <p/>Cyberspeed comes in handy sometimes . <p/>CNN , where I host a weekly program , did n't report it until 3:59 , but the blogs went crazy -- lead story on HuffPost , top of Drudge 's page , then the NYT and others . <p/>Gupta would n't comment to me -- while not <mark id="mark_id"> denying </mark> the story -- but confirmed on his Twitter feed that he `` has been approached by the Obama administration about the U.S. surgeon general 's post . '' <p/>Everyone 's digital these days . <p/>It 's interesting that Obama was so intent on recruiting him that he met with the `` House Call '' host for 2 1/2 hours on Nov. 25 . <p/>He seems to want an administration of stars in the Hillary mode . <p/>Gupta does n't have a Panetta problem -- he operates inside people 's heads , after all -- and has always been drawn to health policy , since a stint in the Clinton White House .

text: Despite his arrest on suspicion of driving under the influence early yesterday , Chargers receiver Vincent Jackson will play in Sunday 's AFC divisional playoff game at Pittsburgh .
marked_sentence: Despite his arrest on <mark id="mark_id"> suspicion </mark> of driving under the influence early yesterday , Chargers receiver Vincent Jackson will play in Sunday 's AFC divisional playoff game at Pittsburgh .
marked_doc: Jackson arrested on DUI charge <p/>Despite his arrest on <mark id="mark_id"> suspicion </mark> of driving under the influence early yesterday , Chargers receiver Vincent Jackson will play in Sunday 's AFC divisional playoff game at Pittsburgh . <p/>Jackson , 25 , was driving east on state Route 52 near Interstate 805 just after 2:30 a.m. when he was pulled over for an observed traffic violation , California Highway Patrol Officer Brad Baehr said . <p/>Jackson faces the misdemeanor DUI allegation as well as charges that he was driving on probation for a prior DUI in June 2006 , Baehr said . <p/>The results of a blood test are pending . <p/>Jackson proffered his innocence in a statement released yesterday afternoon . <p/>`` This morning I was stopped by an officer , '' Jackson said in the statement . <p/>`` I do n't think any charges will be filed as a result of the stop . <p/>In the event they are , I look forward to clearing my name and proving my innocence . '' <p/>The arrest will not affect Jackson 's status for Sunday 's game . <p/>The NFL 's collective bargaining agreement gives the league , not teams , authority to punish players for alcohol and substance abuses . <p/>Any discipline by the league would be meted out for the 2009 season , several sources said . <p/>A suspension certainly is possible . <p/>The NFL 's substance-abuse policy states : `` Discipline for a second or subsequent offense is likely to be a suspension , the duration of which may escalate for repeat offenses . '' <p/>Jared Allen , then with Kansas City , was suspended for the first four games of the 2007 season after being charged with DUI twice in one year . <p/>The NFL later reduced his suspension to two games . <p/>Chargers players had the day off yesterday . <p/>General Manager A.J. Smith issued the following statement on Jackson 's arrest : <p/>`` We 're aware of the off-the-field issue involving Vincent . <p/>Obviously , we 're disappointed . <p/>We take these issues very seriously . <p/>Moving forward , we will monitor the situation and have no further comment . '' <p/>Jackson was driving a 2008 GMC Sierra registered to him , Baehr said . <p/>He was booked into county jail and was released by 6 a.m. , Baehr said . <p/>Jackson , in his fourth season , caught a career-high 59 passes and led the team with 1,098 yards , also a career high . <p/>His seven receiving touchdowns were also a career best and second on the team . <p/>Earlier this week , Smith called Jackson a `` true professional '' and `` ultimate team player '' for how hard Jackson played even while not catching any passes . <p/>`` You win championships with players like Vincent Jackson , '' Smith said . <p/>The general manager has put an emphasis on character and avoiding off-the-field issues . <p/>The Chargers have not had any arrests become public this season and have been relatively trouble-free in recent years . <p/>In 2006 , linebacker Steve Foley was shot by an off-duty Coronado policeman who suspected Foley of driving under the influence . <p/>Foley pleaded guilty to misdemeanor drunken driving and was placed on five years ' probation . <p/>In July , he settled a lawsuit against the city of Coronado for $ 5.5 million . <p/>Jackson 's contract runs through 2009 , and he is among the hottest young receivers in the league . <p/>What becomes of this incident , combined with the previous DUI , could affect Jackson 's long-term future with the Chargers . <p/>Smith has let go a number of players who have had off-the-field troubles . <p/>While none was as productive or possessed the upside of Jackson , Smith did last February release tackle Shane Olivea just two years after signing Olivea to a contract that guaranteed him $ 9 million . <p/>Olivea later underwent treatment for an addiction to pain killers . <p/>`` You 're a Charger one year at a time , '' Smith has often said . <p/>Recently , speaking of the lack of incidents involving his players , Smith said , `` It 's very important if you want to be a Charger you do the right things on and off the field . '' <p/>The Chargers leave Friday for Pittsburgh , where they will face the Steelers at 1:45 p.m. Sunday .

text: In a surprising move nearly three weeks following the end of their season , the Sixers fired Jim O'Brien on Monday after one season as coach and replaced him with Cheeks , one of the most popular players in franchise history .
marked_sentence: In a surprising <mark id="mark_id"> move </mark> nearly three weeks following the end of their season , the Sixers fired Jim O'Brien on Monday after one season as coach and replaced him with Cheeks , one of the most popular players in franchise history .
marked_doc: http : / / sports . espn . go . com / nba / news / story ? id=2066717 <p/>Mo Cheeks will take over as new coach <p/>Updated : May 24 , 2005 , 3 : 23 PM ET <p/>Maurice Cheeks is running the show again for the Philadelphia 76ers . <p/>In a surprising <mark id="mark_id"> move </mark> nearly three weeks following the end of their season , the Sixers fired Jim O'Brien on Monday after one season as coach and replaced him with Cheeks , one of the most popular players in franchise history . <p/>"Mo is family . <p/>Mo bleeds 76ers . He bleeds Philadelphia , " team president Billy King said . <p/>Cheeks will be introduced as Philadelphia's 21st head coach at a Tuesday news conference . <p/>Philadelphia is certainly banking on the former point guard to have a happier homecoming than O'Brien , a Philadelphia native who played for Saint Joseph's . <p/>O'Brien's stubbornness and seemingly unwavering belief in a system that didn't fit his players cost him his job despite a 43 - 39 record and a return to the playoffs . <p/>"I just felt the direction we were going and the overall play wasn't where we wanted to go , " King said . <p/>O'Brien just finished the first year of a three - year deal that included an option and paid him about $4 million a year . <p/>O'Brien , though , was not very popular with his players - - most notably former All - Star Chris Webber - - who often complained about their roles . <p/>King said after the Sixers were eliminated in the first round of the playoffs by Detroit that he planned to bring O'Brien back . <p/>After meeting with his players and other members of management , King had a change of heart and decided over the weekend he had to make a change . <p/>Certainly , King knows a thing or two about making changes - - Cheeks will be the fifth Sixers coach in four years under his watch . <p/>Larry Brown left for Detroit following the 2002 - 03 season , and assistant Randy Ayers was promoted and fired 52 games into the 2003 - 04 season before he was replaced by Chris Ford . <p/>"I knew this thing was coming , and it wasn't an easy thing for anybody , " Brown said from Miami before coaching the Pistons in the Eastern Conference finals . <p/>"Knowing Billy , it's not easy to let a coach go . <p/>His relationship with Randy was pretty strong . <p/>I think it was hard for him to let Chris go . <p/>He was excited about having Jimmy , but I don't think it ever gets easy . " <p/>Cheeks was one of the most popular 76ers from 1978 - 89 and played on Philadelphia's last championship team in 1983 . <p/>He also spent seven seasons as an assistant coach for the 76ers , was part of the staff under Brown when they went to the NBA Finals in 2001 and developed a strong bond with Allen Iverson . <p/>Cheeks was fired March 2 after nearly four seasons as coach of the Trail Blazers . <p/>He had a 162 - 139 record in Portland , the fourth - highest win total in Blazers history . <p/>Cheeks guided the team to the playoffs his first two seasons , but the players hardly made Cheeks' tenure easy - - on or off the court . <p/>The team was nicknamed the "Jail Blazers" after several brushes with the law , many of them involving marijuana possession . <p/>"If players have problems with Mo Cheeks . . . then there's got to be something wrong with those players , " King said . <p/>But Cheeks' return to the city where he was a four - time All - Star shouldn't come as a surprise . <p/>The Trail Blazers turned down Philadelphia's request to speak to Cheeks as a possible replacement for Brown , but the former point guard always remained popular with Philly fans and was at the top of the Sixers' short list to take over for Ford . <p/>Now , they'll get their wish . <p/>"We do not want to change coaches [ again ] , " Sixers chairman Ed Snider said . <p/>"We've seen enough coaches . " <p/>The Sixers will pay Ayers , O'Brien and Cheeks next season . <p/>"I don't think it's something we're very proud of , but I don't think it reflects poorly , " Snider said . <p/>O'Brien is the son - in - law of Hall of Fame coach Jack Ramsay . <p/>He led the Sixers to a 10 - win improvement from a year ago and they returned to the playoffs , largely on the back of a healthy , happy Iverson . <p/>While O'Brien avoided public spats with Iverson , he did not have the full support of the rest of the team . <p/>Some of the younger players , like Samuel Dalembert and Willie Green , felt they did not develop like they should have under O'Brien and were unsure about their roles . <p/>"In looking at the development of some of them , yeah , I wasn't pleased , " King said . <p/>The Sixers also failed to really understand O'Brien's defense , a sticking point even in the postseason . <p/>"Some of the criteria on our defense wasn't there , " King said . <p/>Cheeks , who once famously came to the rescue of a 13 - year - old girl who forgot the words to the national anthem before a playoff game , now hopes to bail out his former team and bring them another championship . <p/>"Mo has played this game here in Philadelphia , won a championship here in Philadelphia , understands players , understands defenses , understands the way I think we want to play , " King said .

text: A British climber has fallen to his death in New Zealand .
marked_sentence: A British climber has <mark id="mark_id"> fallen </mark> to his death in New Zealand .
marked_doc: http : / / www . theguardian . com / world / 2013 / sep / 16 / british - climber - dies - new - zealand - buckley <p/>British climber dies in New Zealand fall <p/>Robert Buckley the second climber to die in the Aoraki - Mount Cook national park at the weekend <p/>Monday 16 September 2013 03 . 31 BST <p/>A British climber has <mark id="mark_id"> fallen </mark> to his death in New Zealand . <p/>Robert Buckley , 32 , fell about 2 , 000 feet while climbing to a small hut on Mount Sefton in the Aoraki - Mount Cook national park on Saturday , police said . <p/>Buckley , who had been living and working in Christchurch , was one of four men who were trying to climb to the Sefton Bivvy from Mount Cook Village , according to New Zealand media reports . <p/>They were within 80m of their destination when Buckley slipped . <p/>His companions raised the alarm , but then got stuck . <p/>A rescue helicopter found Buckley and the others but they could not be rescued until the next morning . <p/>Buckley's body was recovered later in the day . <p/>Police said in a statement it appeared the group was insufficiently equipped and experienced for the climb . <p/>The three other climbers were released after an examination by medical staff . <p/>The day before Buckley's death another climber , 36 - year - old Duncan Rait , died after slipping and falling about 200 feet from a ridge in the same national park . <p/>The New Zealand - born man , who lived in Australia , had been been dropped off by helicopter and was walking to a hut when he fell in the Tasman Glacier area . <p/>Police spokesman Dave Gaskin said the deaths were a reminder that climbers needed to use extreme caution . <p/>'I cant speak for the first death , but in this case it looks like to be a lack of experience , " Gaskin told the Timaru Herald . <p/>A Foreign Office spokeswoman said : "We are aware of the death of a British man in New Zealand . <p/>We are providing consular assistance at this time .
